description:
Always great food. You'll get your food after maybe 10 min max of ordering. They cook super quick and give the food really hot. Wait can be a little long on Sunday mornings but it's worth it. 

I got the "chilaquiles con casamiento" with no green bell peppers. Delicious. Oh and a iced vanilla latte which they made a cute little sun latte art :)
author: Irma B.

description:
The food was good for a first timer, the service was terrible. I had to ask repeatedly for a glass of water. Two Spanish speaking women came in 5 minutes after our two top did and they had their drinks in hand and orders taken before our drinks were delivered. 
Like I said, the food was good.. I had the super burrito and it was so tasty, contained nothing but fresh ingredients but when it was rolled, the cook put her finger through the tortilla so when I ate it, it split and fell apart. My co-worker really enjoyed the grilled chicken sandwich ordered. Said it was one of the best. Our server didn't come and ask if everything was okay with our food until we each had finished. 

Enjoy that $2 tip I left on that $30 tab.... You earned every cent!
author: Michael S.

description:
I want to like tho spot but i left disappointed. 

The service was very good, all the workers were polite and attentive.

The food wasn't bad but I think the portions were small for the prices. I ordered the chilaquiles and it was mostly chips with one lonely small scrambled egg. The menu said it came with beans and when I got my plate the beans were in a tiny little cup. We also ordered a side of casamiento for $6 and when it came to the table it was one scoop. 

Now the food tasted good, the orange juice was fresh but I just think for the price the portions aren't worth it. I feel like I could have gone elsewhere and paid the same price for way more food.
author: Samantha N.

description: Very good breakfast sausage burrito, average coffee. Reading all the rave reviews of the cappuccino here I was pretty excited to try it. Well it looked very pretty, but the taste was just average. It was warm, not even hot. Overall just an average place for breakfast.
author: Tania C.

description:
Delicious breakfast joint with Mexican style dishes. I had their huevos rancheros with the eggs poached, and my bf had their chilaquiles. Both were really good and mine came with my choice of corn or flour tortillas-- I chose the flour tortillas and they came all hot and soft wrapped in foil. Getting seated took a while since it's busy, but the food was delicious and we left happy. 
I would come back to this spot if I am in the area.
author: Christina W.

description: Marquitta and Garric love Red Cafe! Always crowded with good vibes. The food is well prepared, and made with love. It is comfort food made with the heart of the Mission District. Try the Oatmeal Pancakes.
author: Garric S.

description: We come here if we can almost everyday. This place has great staff, fast service and quality food! My favorite right now is the Red Cafe Salad without the pico de gallo. (A little spicy for me) Highly recommend the Chillaquiles and the Micky Pancakes! They warmed my coffee milk today! Great staff!! Gracias Sophia for being great with my family and I.
author: Rafaela R.

description: Solid brunch spot in mission with affordable prices and good seating! Would recommend the scrambles and French toast :)
author: Annie W.

description:
Came here for the first time on a Sunday around lunchtime for a late breakfast. It was crowded but we got seated immediately at a booth by one of the very friendly waitresses. The crowd seemed like a great mix of locals/regulars and tourists - bustling bar area but not overly cramped. This seemed to be your standard local diner, with a Mexican influence. 

The menu had a lot of great breakfast offerings, with some Mexican breakfast options alongside the standard breakfast/lunch fare. We opted for the the Southwestern omelette, corned beef hash, hash browns, wheat and white breads (the latter which came with our meal). The portions were very generous and easily filled us up. 

My boyfriend was very impressed with his corned beef hash overall, however he was disappointed that his poached eggs were a little overcooked, which he says didn't allow the yolk to flow as freely as he wanted it to. He also thought the mushrooms were an interesting addition to the dish, which he says he usually doesn't see with corned beef hashed. I loved the Southwestern scramble and thought it had a ton of flavor thanks to the chorizo. The omelette was really stuffed with a ton of vegetables and meat, and was the perfect mix of egg and filling. 

We both were huge fans of how the hash browns were cooked - just right in terms of crispiness and flavor! Each dish also came with two piece of toast cut in half, with both strawberry and blueberry jam and butter. This simple side really complemented the meal well.

We'll definitely be coming back here in the future. Seems like the perfect way to start your weekend day, regardless of how late you're getting started.

***A rather random note, but this place seemed to also be very handicapped accessible, with a designated handicapped table and many of the booth tables being longer with what seemed like great spaces for wheelchairs or even high chairs for children.
author: Jenny D.

description:
Pros: One of the very few places that didn't have a line out the door. They were able to accommodate us fairly quickly (Sunday morning brunch).
Cons: The food is very fast food ish. Portions weren't big.
author: Bashir A.

description: My go-to, San Francisco favorite for breakfast. Great service. Amazing food. Feels like an old school diner.  Tastes like your abuelita is cooking in the back and your besties chillin in the living room.  So damn fantastic.
author: Nancy G.

description: Great food! The casamiento platano breakfast plate is a must try! The casamiento is amazing! The platanos are also always perfect, soft and sweet as they should be! I have also tried their chicken nachos, which are very fresh and light, very different from taqueria nachos. Their burgers are also on point. Staff is very receptive and friendly.
author: Mas M.

description:
Seriously good breakfast value here. Unless you get there before 8, there's always a line -- which tells you something. The banana pancakes and Santa Fe omelet are of especial note. 

Lots of Latin breakfast items too. I'm told the plantains are particularly good though I haven't sampled them. 

It's fun to sit at the bar and watch the chef cut and flip the hash browns and eggs. Potatoes on the grill, then a slash and flip with a spatula. Then they crack the eggs and toss the shell about five feet into the trash. They never miss!

I'm on my way there right now for a spicy Santa Fe omelet with chorizo and broccoli. It's a great combination of spice and crunch.

2018: finally tried the carne deshilada. Soooooo yummy!
author: Tim P.

description: Best customer service   I love their fresh orange juice and their platanos w casamientos
author: Erika E.

description:
Brunch:
Veggie sandwich - okayish
Pancake - felt a little burnt
Good service but nothing else too good to call out.
author: Aanchal G.

description:
Nothing on your plate tastes particularly fresh, the menu is overpriced, and all the food seems to consist of second-tier ingredients. And yet with all its glaring and frustrating flaws, I find myself returning to Red Cafe.
Well, partly because I live nearby... BUT that aside, the place is almost always bustling with customers. So then how can they continually keep their doors open and seats filled? It's because Red Cafe, like many small restaurants in the Mission, is food by the people for the people. It's simple traditional Mexican breakfast for the locals. You will not see sightseers or tourists walking in here for brunch, especially when they could just hop over to the flashier taquerias across the street. No, rather you will see Mission residents greeting each other and the staff and enjoying simple food like this that keeps the spirit of the neighborhood alive.

At least, that's what I try to tell myself. I honestly can't in good faith give the food anything higher than a 2.5/5. The only times I haven't regretted my faith in the establishment after receiving the bill is when I've ordered oatmeal pancakes, which are admittedly quite delicious. I mean $4.50 for a cup of not-so-fresh orange juice is pretty outrageous. This is probably a spot to avoid unless you've exhausted all the other breakfast options in the area, in which case you are probably a local by then and Red Cafe welcomes you with open doors and meh food.
author: Stephen C.

description: The Avocado burger was absolutely amazing. We shared one and it filled us both up. Good service, food came fast. Definitely coming back here
author: Lise G.

description:
Great breakfast spot close to the Bart station!

Came here early Saturday morning with my dad before it got too busy. They have a bunch of Latin American breakfast dishes, but I ended up deciding on their oatmeal pancakes. The pancakes were hearty and good. You can also add fresh fruits to it if you're feeling fancy. My dad went with their Santa Fe omelette, which was equally as good and came with pretty generous portions. 

Service was great and our coffee cups were never empty. The price was also pretty good for the quality and quantity of food they have. Would stop by again and definitely recommend.
author: Madeleine V.

description:
Nice dinner spot in mission.

Parking could be better, example if there were free city operated parking garages to service the neighborhood.  But it will take a while for the USA to get priorities straight
author: Fanshu B.

description:
This place have good variable breakfast. Many country's food. 
Good and Great . 
The server is ok
author: Grecia N.

description: This place is like a fusion cafe between American and South American brunch cuisine. I got the santa fe omelette when I visited today and it was a great combination of meat and veggies that work really well together. It came with a side of hash brown that was cooked amazingly where the potato was soft enough it breaks apart easily and yet well done enough that there was a firmness in texture. The restaurant itself is pretty small and it gives you an intimate feel with the waiters. The service here was also good. Overall would come back again
author: Erik C.

description: Food was ok-ish, but server sat next to me on the bar, playing a game on his phone with loud sound on. Since when is that ok?
author: Eyal S.

description: I adore Red Cafe! It's my go to spot for Sunday brunch because everything is delicious and well-priced. I usually alternate between the huevos rancheros, huevos ala Mexicana and the chilaquiles! And I always get an order of French toast with fruit to share with friends. Not to mention, the coffee is tasty!
author: Jeanette Jane G.

description:
This is my go to spot for some good comfort breakfast food. I always order the egg white veggie scramble with extra crispy hash browns. It really hits the spot every time! Their coffee is standard but their orange juice is fantastic.

The servers are friendly but obviously overworked and stretched thin. They are genuine and authentic which I really value and appreciate. It feels like a local neighborhood spot because they remember you from before. There is often a wait out the door but the line goes pretty fast.
author: Jacqui C.

description: This is one of my go to places for breakfast because it's close to my house, the wait isn't too crazy, and it's consistently good food. The food isn't greasy and leaves you feeling full and satisfied.  The hash browns are nice and crispy on the outside and the best part is the option to have tortillas instead of toast! My fav is the country scramble that comes with avocado and melted cheese on top! It does get busy on the weekends, but the wait typically isn't more than 20 minutes and the service is really good.
author: Janice C.

description:
The wait was a little long but it's because we came in right at brunch. They seated us promptly and gave us our menus. We had the French toast and the Supreme Omelette. Both were soooo amazing! The omelette was packed with meat, it was layers of eggs and meat! Upgrade the French toast, it's worth it! They really top it with bananas and strawberries! Super bomb! 
The service was great and you could tell how busy everyone was. Once a table was done, they cleared it promptly so they could seat other waiting customers. Glad we stopped by
author: Stephanie N.

description:
This place is the bomb dot com. One of my favorite go to spots in the mission. Been coming here ever since I lived in Bay. Happened to stumble upon it when visiting and reminded of why I loved this place. Simple affordable and delicious. My three criteria for bomb spots. 

Other thing about this place is that even though it is an American style diner all the workers are Latino (of course). So it has a Latino flare and Latino breakfast items.
author: Abel M.

description:
This is my favorite breakfast spot in San Francisco!! I found this place because I was hungry prior to a job interview nearby, and since I first walked in I fell in love! Since then, I've only ordered the Platanos con Casamiento because this is all I need. It's a small humble diner, and often times there is a wait outside, but the wait isn't very long. Due to its small location, there is a small amount of employees, but they do a good job of checking in on you and getting you served in a timely manner. 

I noticed someone else complained about the beans in their review. That person clearly doesn't know beans. The refried beans here are amazing! I love that they are not super thick; these are easier to eat. Different cultures make their refried beans differently, and it's also dependent on individual family cultures as well. Some like their refried beans thick enough to form a ball, and some like it thinner in consistency. Even when I make refried beans they come out different every time depending on my mood and how I want them that day. 

Also, someone was attempting to degrade this diner due to its "quality" of food. This is a diner, not a Michelin star restaurant, so calm your bougie bootie down. Makes me mad when people try to rate humble establishments when they only go to expensive bougie restaurants. 

Anyways, this place is awesome! Every time I come to San Francisco this is the spot I have to eat at. I hope they continue to remain open and overcome gentrification
author: Jessica A.

description:
This review could easily have been more positive were it not for the attitude of the presumed owner.

We came here for a Mexican style breakfast. The dish advertised refried beans - which is normal. We asked if there were other bean options and were told by the owner that there was not.  

The other order was for the breakfast burrito which was served with green salsa - and was actually pretty tasty - but we asked for the red salsa they had as an alternative.

When we were served - a small ramekin of the red salsa was served, which we found out later we were charged $1.79. Had we been informed of the charge when we ordered it we might still have opted for it - but we should have been informed.

We were also charged extra without notice for the chopped up pepper my wife asked to be added to her dish.

Back to the beans - they were so liquid that it they seemed like the water remaining after boiling pinto beans. To add insult, the owner who told us there were no other options sat down right next to us with a plate full of plump beans. When my wife asked why she was told there were no other beans he smirked and gave no real answer. 

The food was not horrible - but not special enough to make up for the un caring customer service. We will try another option next time.
author: Kevin S.

description: I live this place and have been coming here for years. The customer service has improved as well. The food is delicious, especially the Latin Breakfast. The only thing I don't like is the people that come in to play on their guitar and sing and then ask for tip money.
author: Couture A.

description: The bottomless coffee is great. Good coffee means great owners. You can tell how much they care about their business if they take care of the smallest details. The food is tasty and filling. The place is a little old and run down. The price is on point and reasonable. I will be back to try other dishes.
author: Jacob A.

description:
What a hidden gem. From the outside, one would never know how great of a breakfast diner this place is, but I am so happy we found it! 

Sofía, our server, was EXTREMELY friendly and very, very fast in providing quick service on a busy Tuesday morning. 

I accidentally ordered a breakfast burrito with bacon (I actually wanted the breakfast quesadilla, but for some reason said the burrito instead). I also added a side hash brown since my burrito was one of the few breakfast entrees that didn't come with it. 
My friend also ordered a breakfast burrito with both sausage and bacon with a side coffee. 

Our food came out very quickly (literally in about 6-7 minutes. Unfortunately, I found that my burrito only had sausage instead of bacon. I called the attention of Sofia and she quickly apologized and had the cooks made the burrito with bacon. It may have been a mistake on my part (It could've been a miscommunication), but it was no problem at all. She let me keep the sausage burrito anyways and brought out a new breakfast bacon burrito. 

JESUS, was it good! With the salsa/hot sauce provided, this breakfast burrito might be tied with one of the best ones I've ever had! My friend even said the same thing for his. 

I really commend this establishment for its quick service on my visit, for the great customer service provided by Sophia (and the cooks), and the fact that we got seated quickly. 

Thanks again!
author: Andrew P.

description:
Stopped by here on a Saturday with some friends from college. Arrived at 10 AM and managed to get a seat after waiting for 15 min. Not terribly long for a 10-11 am brunch in SF

The food here is good, but nothing that couldn't be made at home for a fraction of the cost. Most of the menu is fairly standard brunch affair and I was at least expecting a decent amount of food for the price I paid. Unfortunately not the case.

I also fell into the trap of ordering coffee. Save your cash and go elsewhere for coffee. I understand that not all places focus on their coffee, but for the price they charge you gotta get something that isn't lukewarm brown water.
author: Derek L.

description:
I was fairly surprised by just how many people came on a mid-morning weekday! The line was literally out the door and around the block on a Monday! WHAT?!

I started off my meal with a cappuccino and was very happy with its delivery. The foam was thick and I felt the foam moustache forming before I even had a sip of the coffee...a sign of a correctly made cappuccino!

For my entree, I opted for the corn beef hash with hash browns and toast. The corn beef hash is very colorful compared to most. It featured tomatoes, onions, mushrooms, scallions, and poached eggs on top. It met all my needs - savory, creamy, sweet, etc! Yum. The hash browns were also made well...just how I like it. Crisp outside, fluffy inside. Many places these days deep fry the hell out of them which makes it a potato chip...so a classic make is much appreciated! The only downside was the toast. It was completely forgettable...hardly toasted and just soggy.

My friend ordered the quesadillas and thought it very good. She wasn't a fan of the onions but did order it specifically for the generous portion of avocado that came with it.
author: Elaine Y.

description: This place is fantastic. Try the egg white jalepeno or the chiliquillies.  The neighborhood is gorgeous.
author: Cris V.

description: Love affair ended long time ago. Way, way too overpriced!
author: Anabelle B.

description:
Artisinal coffee?
Nope.

Organic chicken apple sausage?*
Nope.

Vegan soy anything?
Nope.

Hipsters everywhere?
Nope.

Basic Mexican diner food like guacalicious breakfast quesadillas?
YEP.

*https://youtu.be/WAlWrT5P2VI?t=20s
author: Amy C.

description: Enjoyed a delicious Sunday breakfast @ Red Cafe around 10am. We beat the rush and enjoyed our fresh squeezed OJ, coffee, burrito, chorizo omelette, pancakes, and quesadilla!
author: Sherry W.

description: Been to the cafe several times and always enjoyed the service and food. Today's lunch was awful. Ordered steak fajitas and meat was tough, full of fat and grizzle. Service was poor also!
author: Dan S.

description:
This place was middle of the road. Wasn't bad or good. Ordered the plantains and they were okay. If you need food eat it. Long lines tend to form and there isn't a ton of seating so plan ahead. 

Service is also okay.
author: Chhaya N.

description: It was awesome, and reasonable price. It's good to see that Latinos run this cafe. Keep mission Latino.
author: Oscar G.

description: Yes, I know people love Dottie's for breakfast. My current personal favorite is Red Cafe...Mexican breakfast at it's finest. Recommended:Huevos Mexicana with refried beans, hash browns and corn tortillas on the side. The coffee is excellent. Service is perfect...place is clean and has a good vibe all around. I will return for huevos rancheros.
author: Bleep S.

description:
If you like cheap of the cheap boxed and processed food off the Sysco truck this place is for you!  
I had the ham, sausage and bacon omelet - tasted as slapped together as it looks and all of the meats are institutional-low grade and super salty. If you like your omelet browned and eggs rubbery, then by all means, this is your place.
If the quality standard of corned beef hash is Dinty Moore - surely order it!  You'll get chopped up mash of a salt lick only about 1500g sodium per serving, very optimal if you are going to a baseball pick up game and your forgot your catcher's mitt as your salt-swollen hand will suffice as a defacto cowhide mitt.  Bonus - you have 2 mitts for the price of one.  Bonus, some limp sautéed onions and pepper camouflage your back to school special.
Do you like your service to range from half clueless, to, "oh you want another Diet Coke - I'll get HER to get it for you" - then you're in business.
Like to turn in to a fossil?  Then waiting for what seemed like the Pleistocene era for the bill from the detached coven of servers chatting it up around the register when the restaurant is packed - well, here is your golden ticket, Archaeopteryx!!!
Hashbrowns boxed and dry - so they can't ever get truly crispy - check.
English muffins and accompanying "jam" - prison quality, get the feeling of a felon without the arrest and trial.
Soft Poached Eggs- ask for soft and get a lovely hard poached easter egg quality hard boil just short of green yolk choker status.  
Now I'm sure i'm being sacrilegious to some of the locals who inhabit this popular spot, but mind you I'm fairly patient and tolerant as a diner, and I respect your fave spot.  
As for me - I'll always make sure to avoid this place like the plague.  The important meal of the day is breakfast - I'll just find the places that respect the craft, and in this town the choices are myriad, countless, multitudinous.
author: Kevin M.

description: Perfect spot for a quick American breakfast. They also had a couple of Latin breakfasts which I had. Beans, eggs, cotija ripe plantanos and crema. So yummy. I usually opt out of cake with syrup for breakfast so if you do too this is the perfect plate and perfect size. It's filling and soooo tasty! It's very popular, on busy mornings it can feel cramped, but the price is right and the food is satisfying so definitely worth it. Great for locals who want good food without the tourist prices.
author: Mish A.

description:
When you're looking for a homey, casual Mexican breakfast, give this place a try!

Food: Ordered the corn beef hash and the boyfriend had a meaty omelet. Both came with hash browns and toast with lots of butter and jam on the side. I think our total was only around $20! What I like best about this place is the extended menu with classic diner foods and Mexican options. And you can tell with the amount of Spanish spoken in the restaurant, this place is very popular. And I'm hoping that means it's authentic! Something that did bother was my boyfriend's omelet came with cheese... As in a Kraft slice of cheese on top of the omelet as an afterthought and not in the omelet itself. It wasn't even half melted...

Service: Not as quick as I had hoped... It's an open kitchen so you can see all the hustle and bustle but for two simple dishes, it took at least 20 mins for us to get served. And they forgot our toast until we reminded them :(

Ambiance: Loud and noisy but a lot of people like that vibe for breakfast/brunch. Place is really bright and airy with lots of windows. Could be a good hungover-next-morning-brunch joint or a breakfast with the whole family place :)
author: Lucy Z.

description: Food was good.  Service was awesome.  Had the corned beef hash which was better than I expected.  The coffee was superb and the orange juice fresh squeezed.  Definitely a place to visit again!
author: Don A.

description: Recommend. Excellent breakfast. Definitely top 5 restaurants in SF for breakfast. Customer service is very good. I have been eating breakfast here for approximately 5 years.
author: Robert G.

description:
Inexpensive, bang for your buck type of place! I got the crossaint sandwich and was surprised about the big portion. I even had leftovers

Perfect place to bring your family. In a convenient place (corner restaurant).. Not sure about the parking.
author: Amy V.

description:
Came here after dropping off my dog at SPCA. Was in the mood for breakfast burro on the go. Wanted to go to Hazel's kitchen but didn't want to backtrack. Placed order here for breakfast burrito on busy Saturday morning. Waited about 10 mins. I got the order and the waiter abruptly and with a suspicious tone asked me twice "did you pay yet"?. I'm thinking of course I did, how else would I have made the order? Anyway only slightly annoyed but its all good if the burrito and potato is bomb. Walk to my car and open the box.and I find a barely stuffed  burrito. Burrito was lacking any real substance since it was mostly filled with cheese and little sausage pieces.

Overall dealing with impertinent staff and poor delivery of food I will take my business elsewhere and hope all my friends do the same.
author: Jude N.

description: Four stars for red cafe. Not the best spot, inexpensive, food is average, service could be better. The interior itself could look a bit messy and somewhat dirty. We sat at the bar and watched the cooks make our food, which always interests me. The menu is pretty big, good selections, usual breakfast food. We uber'd, but parking looked to be scarce.
author: Alvin B.

description: Best mexican american breakfast in the mission. Almost always a line, but thats a sign. This place is good. Love their chilaquiles and there omlettes are tasty. Pancakes and more. Service is super quick.
author: Liset O.

description:
Quick service! Diner feel. Although there was a little bit of a wait, the timing all worked out well especially with our slightly larger size group (5) for the small place. Food was quick and portions were a good size. 
Menu is very Mexican / American.

I had the Chilaquiles, which were probably the least authentic style I've had before but the flavors were all good though. I wish I had added meat to them though. It needed a bit more substance. 
Nachos were a great portion and looked great. 
My sister and Grandma both had omelets and they were both happy with those. 
My mom had the Huevos Rancheros- I didnt get a good view of them but she said she enjoyed them. 

Overall a happy bunch
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Solid three stars.

Red Cafe is an inexpensive diner with an enormous menu. The food isn't the best in terms of quality, but it is pretty cheap. You can choose from a number or breakfast options (eggs, french toast, etc) to sandwiches, salads, burgers, burritos, and quesadillas.

The portions are huge. Sandwiches and burgers come with a side of your choice. The food comes out pretty quickly, and the the servers are very friendly. She opted for the croissant sandwich with onion rings and I got the veggie burger with french fries. The onion rings and fries weren't great - a both a bit soggy. The croissant sandwich was toasted and looked pretty good. My veggie burger was enormous, stuffed with veggies and a veggie patty. The patty sadly crumbled a bit, but it was pretty average tasting. 

Also this place has a clean bathroom.

All in all a decent place to grab something cheap and filling.
author: Umeet S.

description: Their tuna sandwich is amazing! It's hard to make a tuna sandwich good but they really do it well! For $9 it's a great deal as well :)
author: Genna F.

description: Delicious classic diner - this is our go-to spot for breakfast on the weekends.  It's got a nice hustle and bustle with people enjoying simple but good food.  The omelettes all come with hash browns & toast or tortillas.  I typically save half of my omelette to eat later in the day because it is so filling! All the omelettes I've sampled are delicious, along with the Platanos con Casamiento - yum!  With tax & tip, our meal for 2 large meals & coffee is typically around $30. Just arrive early to avoid a wait!
author: Caroline T.

description:
This  brother (David) makes a MEAN cappuccino!  I gauge my caps on a 0 to 5 scale (do they make me feel like I did when I had my very first in a street cafe in Paris?)  This is a sturdy 4! Perfect foam, no sugar necessary (that's saying something for me) and strong enough to know I'm drinking coffee.

Ok, lets talk grub. I came here ISO gluten free breakfast options (sister really wanted pancakes) but when I saw the plantanos con casamiento I knew I'd be okay.

I had my eggs scrambled with mushrooms and they were moist and fluffy.  No salt necessary (you see I judge my food by how much stuff I have to add to it) and the plantanos and casamiento were seasoned and cooked to perfection.

Friendly and attentive service (y'all need to tip people right when they are good to you) in this family style corner spot. Clean, comfortable spots to sit (booth) and relax while enjoying your meal.

Good music on the radio (mix popular, I'm too old to know any of the songs but I didn't feel the need to put my headphones on so that's a good sign. "Sugar how'd you get so fly" is on now so Imma check out soundcloud to get some deets.  David tends to sing a bit so if you are lucky and listen when he's doing his thing you'll get a little smile.

Sweet spot.
author: Saundra D.

description: After waiting for some time the hostess failed to call us audibly when we were no more than 20 feet from the front door. So our table was given away. When I told her about this issue and asked how much longer it would take us to get seated she became very defensive, interrupting my question and offering no indication of how much longer we'd have to wait. Not fair and not accommodating to our party with a guest in a wheelchair. The manager behind the counter offered no help either, so had to leave. The place looked a bit dirty as well.
author: Manny V.

description:
The corned beef is the best in the world! Abit salty thou. But the hashed Browns and the poached eggs and the sour dough bread gave it a good balance of its taste! 

Love the oatmeal pancakes too! Ingenious and yummy with the apple jelly and maple spread!
author: Angelina A.

description: Excellent service. It was a line but we waited less than 15 minutes. The pancakes for the kids were good and super cute. I would definitely go back. Coffee was good and eggs with plantains and Gallopinto very tasty.
author: Mapi V.

description: If you like cheap reheated food with no taste red Cafe is for you.  Save yourself the money and learn to cook yourself.
author: Thomas D.

description: Absolutely amazing service and delicious food! I was visiting from LA and needed my phone to charged because I needed my phone to be charged in order to use the map app! I was running low on battery and the waiter happily took my phone to the back of the counter and charged it! The food was also really delicious and the mocha was amazing. It also had a really cool design! DEFINITELY recommend. If you're looking for something fancy, this is not the place. It's a humble establishment, but worth it! I would definitely come back.
author: Melina M.

description:
Monday morning. Always drive through here and it's always pack on the weekends. We decided to give it a try.
We got seated right away, took our drinks orders and by the time we started looking at the menu I had my coffee already! Food  came out really fast and it was delicious. 
Highly recommend this place!!!
author: Al a.

description: So red cafe is legit my new exclusive breakfast spot in SF.  As a latino growing up in the Bay Area I saw a lot of taquerias and I've gone to many of them. Outside of tacos and tortas, no place can make food like real Mexican moms. Then I walked into red cafe and felt brace, I ordered chilaquiles. They taste damn near like my moms kitchen. I've never experienced this EVER.  I think everyone should go to this place and don't even look at the menu. Just say chilaquiles please
author: Alfredo B.

description: Came to this restaurant for the first time. Look decent, but then there was a non communication from the staff. That my order never came on time. Also my family member hasld ask for a refill of coffee. Took them almost 10mins to get his refill. My question is what kind of of communication does the waitress/waiters have to attend the cuatomers desires?!
author: A M.

description: Was there yesterday for breakfast, first time. Slight wait. Small corner restaurant, friendly staff, clean, and most important, food was better than expected. Will be there again
author: Al L.

description: Food= delicious! Service= expeditious! Vibe= vibalicous! Red cafe is a hidden gem of a brunch spot in SF!
author: Matt C.

description:
Man so my boyfriend thought he'd be nice and surprise me with a good breakfast. And when we drove by to find parking we saw a bunch of people so I thought it'd be good. Wrong!

I was torn between an American breakfast like pancakes or chilaquiles because I loooooove chilaquiles like most Mexicans do.

Ugh I have never had chilaquiles that made me gag. These were so oily I felt like I was chugging a crunchy bottle of mazola. The green onions that they garnished them with were practically raw. What happened to sautéing them? They threw some random tomato bits and lettuce on the plate too. Their refried beans were more like a bean sauce with pepper out of a can. The green salsa they put on my plate was the most acidic thing I've ever had. No spice, so flavor, just acid. I'm so disappointed. How can anyone seriously put that on a plate and be proud of it? I feel offended that the people patroning the restaurant think this is what Mexican food is.

I didn't return the plate because it's a small family owned business. The servers were alright. Not the most attentive because the place was busy. I don't get why though. It's a small corner building. The air conditioner looked like it needed cleaning and the rest of the place could use some remodeling. But my boyfriend loves the place...
author: Claudia R.

description: Solid breakfast! We had the corned beef hash which was delicious with the addition of cheese and mushrooms. Chilaquiles were tasty but probably not as filling. Oatmeal pancake was hearty and tender and perfect for our toddler. Sure beats waiting 1 hour+ for the pricey breakfast places in Noe!
author: Stephanie L.

description: New favorite breakfast spot! I was greeted by a "Good morning, how're you doing?" as soon as I walked in the door. Had a cup of coffee being filled before I even sat down. My delicious, flavorful French toast with fresh bananas and strawberries in front of me in 7 minutes. Perfect proportion sizes and not overly sweet. Super friendly, low-key vibe. Definitely will be returning.
author: Shel N.

description: We were looking for a breakfast spot and this place delivered!!! I ordered the corned beef hash with no mushrooms and my boyfriend got the 2 eggs any style and we were very impressed! Also cheaper than our usual dennys bill! Staff is nice was served right away. Love the menu and how it's a little hidden gem. Definitely coming back next time in San Francisco.
author: Sabrina Q.

description: A+ neighborhood diner food & ambiance. One breakfast is enough for two people. Ask for your fried eggs done medium if you don't want runny whites. Coffee is authentically terrible.
author: Hawley S.

description: Chilaquiles were scrambled eggs with plain chips under them. NOT real chilaquiles. Disappointing. Still giving 3 stars because on prior visits other options have been good.
author: Ara S.

description:
My go to mexican brunch is San Jalisco (formerly Los Jarritos).

This morning we wanted mexican - but the boy always wants to try someplace new. Yelp led me here.

I reviewed the photos and there was one thing that looked unique. 2 eggs, fried plantains, some kind of mexican cheese and this rice and bean mixture (served with your choice of a tortilla and sour cream. I tell ya, it really hit the sweet spot in my belly.  My bf ordered the huevos rancheros mostly b/c people said it was good and there was no phono on yelp - so we thought we add it to the gallery. it was just alright, the sauce was good but nothing super special, he should have gotten the chiliequiles.  

We sat at the counter and it was fun to see all the action - loved that there was a lady line cook in charge (you don't see that very often).
author: Amy W.

description: Happened across this place while walking to/from an appointment in the area. Picture perfect portrayal of a "greasy spoon" but the silverware was clean! The burger I ordered hit my table QUICKLY and was perfectly cooked. Imagine having the problem of there being TOO MUCH BACON on your sandwich! Yum! The onion rings were perfectly hot and crunchy. Can't wait to check out the rest of the menu!
author: Tony B.

description: Amazing breakfast here! From having my mushroom avocado omelette nicely cooked deliciously to my brother loving his avocado burger ad well. Not from the area, but will come here for breakfast when I'm able too!
author: Lisa S.

description: Good spot for tasty, filling breakfasts. Great coffee and breakfast sandwiches. Portions were very large - prepare for leftovers unless you're very hungry.
author: Sarah R.

description: We had a great breakfast here. Came in early on a Saturday and got seated immediately at the bar (diner style). My husband had the chilaquiles, which he enjoyed but weren't as good as his favorite in Mexico. I had banana pancakes and they were quite good, but I wish they would mix in the bananas instead of just dropping them on top! I ordered a cinnamon cappuccino and it was delicious. I asked for it extra dry (knowing it was a long shot) and alas, it was not extra dry but I will survive :) - I would order that again next time!
author: Kendra N.

description: Nothing special really...its sad there isn't many options when it comes to breakfast in the mission.. service is okay, but it's a dirty place. Always kinda busy but just not for me. Just average...coffee was awful.
author: Patricia H.

description:
This is probably my favorite breakfast place in San Francisco. It can be quite busy on weekends, but if there's a queue it usually moves very fast. 

Highly recommend trying the French Toast, I have no idea how they do it but they get it just slightly crispy, yum!
author: Shaun C.

description: Classic, no-frills, inexpensive breakfast with good service. This is where you go to get a delicious, casual brunch without the super long wait. For a party of four, we waited only 15 mins. Got the French Slam because I can't choose between savory and sweet and I also got a breakfast burrito to go for my boyfriend and according to him, it was the *best* burrito he's ever had. He breathed in the whole thing without me even realizing.
author: Kristine N.

description:
Classic, unpretentious, delicious breakfast at good prices. Great, speedy service. 

We had the a couple of the veggie scrambles loaded with fresh mushrooms, tomatoes, bell peppers, spinach, green onions, and jack cheese - with hash browns or salad, toast, English muffins, or corn or flour tortillas. Fresh ingredients, not greasy. Fresh squeezed OJ is refreshing and really good.

Sit at the counter, it's mesmerizing - the staff and line cooks are machines! 

I'm so glad places like this still survive in this crazy city. Visit often and buy local!
author: T L.

description:
Really good place for breakfast
The food is good and very tasty, but there is usually a wait. Worth the wait since the food is yummy and the prices are very fair.
It is a mixture or Mexican / American breakfast.
author: Jad A.

description:
Great food, cheap prices, quick service!

I'd recommend the chilaquiles, plantains con casamientos and any of the omelettes.
author: V S.

description: My mom and I flew to San Francisco last week and after a long morning of travel we found ourselves in the Mission (near our Airbnb) and absolutely starving! La Taqueria across the street was far too busy, so we wandered into Red Cafe and were super glad we did! The staff was very friendly and the food was tasty. I had a breakfast burrito and my mom had the Eggs a la Mexicana which came with warm tortillas on the side. Good food at a fair price!
author: Clara T.

description:
It was the first meal of our girls' weekend and it was terrible. Good thing the rest of the weekend didn't follow suit.

We arrived around 10 am on a Friday, and the restaurant was packed... and hot! The kitchen is open so the heat is distributed all around the small restaurant. I ordered a shredded beef omelette which was okay, nothing memorable.

The 1 star rating is due to how the staff and manager handled one of my girlfriend's meal. The first mistake was a hair strand nestled in my friend's eggs. She returned her plate, only to get the same meal, but with little egg shells in her eggs. Poor friend was so hungry while we almost finished our food. Upon returning that second plate, we asked to speak with the manager who didn't offer any refund or alternative for my friend's meal. We had to ask for at least a comped meal for our friend, but he only gave her 50%... which sucked considering she didn't even eat it!
We paid for our meals, no tip. Sorry... terrible service, no attention to detail on food quality, and an unprofessional way to handle mistakes.
author: Felicia L.

description: I just moved to Bernal Heights and was looking for breakfast food; this place came up on my Yelp app, and I decided to give it a try. Overall, I was very satisfied: Red Cafe has great service, along with a very expansive menu and large portions. Sometimes big portions means that you're in for quantity over quality, but that wasn't true here at all; I had steak, eggs, toast, hash browns, and coffee, and all were delicious. The restaurant was a little crowded, and the bill seemed a little high for a simple breakfast, but overall I had a great time and would definitely go back.
author: Erik B.

description: Great food! Cute lil local joint... gets busy so go early! Their chilaquiles... O.M.G !
author: Maria A.

description:
Decisions, decisions. My roomie Mal G and I struggled for about a half hour, trying decide where to eat on Sunday morning within walking distance of our place. Mission Beach Cafe, too far. Local's Corner, too formal. St Francis Fountain, been there 100 times. Who knew breaking fast could be so mentally labor intensive? We called on the help of our pal KK who had stayed over to give us some input, as Mal attended to her horribly hungover boyfriend. 

We landed on Red Cafe and treked on over. I didn't really know what to expect, as the menu has some odd grammatical pairings (Grill Cheese, Eggs Sandwich), but whatever, it looked good enough and the place was packed. We waited for about 10 minutes before being seated and ordered coffees as we browsed the menu. Mal and I wanted something light, so we split the Carne Deshilada ($9.59) which we had never heard of, but for the sake of trying something new and based on  the description of the dish, this seemed to be a solid choice. KK ordered the Breakfast Burrito ($7.99) with ham.

The Carne Deshilada was so freakin' good, guys. Though the presentation was different than expected, the flavors were outstanding. It was basically shredded steak  mixed with scrambled eggs with peppers and onions, served with rice, refried beans, and a flour or corn tortilla. We went with flour and it was a good choice. The shredded steak was juicy, sweet, savory, and the beans and rice rounded out the dish. We made little burritos and then I ate the rest with my fork. I added some Tapatio and Tobasco for spice and it was seriously delish. KK ate up her breakfast burrito quickly and said it was grand.

Everything was fresh and hot, coffee was refilled regularly, the staff was super nice, and the price was not too bad. They have more American fare as well, but I'd recommend the Mexican options, muy bien! A definite go-to for great food.
author: Crystal C.

description: The carne asada fries were amazingly good. The asada looked kinda like dog food, but the flavor made up for it. I will definitely be trying more items on the menu. The staff were very friendly and included some salsa for me to try for free. Definitely give this place a shot.
author: Emily L.

description: We went to the cafe and order 2 waters and 2 orange juice and notice our silverware was filthy we told them give us one more min to think about what we wanted 15mins went by still no answer they took other peoples order when we had got there before others. We didn't even get the chance to tell them there silverware was dirty after a while we just left didn't eat didn't even drink the beverages.
author: Carl S.

description: Solid Mexican style breakfast and brunch spot. We waited 5mins before we were seated at the bar where we can watch them cook our food. We started with a double shot latte which comes out with a nice coffee art. We ordered the egg quesadilla and the supreme omelette which was packed full of meat. Items look basic but it tastes above average! The restaurant itself is a bit small but perfect for a party of 2.
author: Judy N.

description: Really great choice if you're looking for a tasty, casual, inexpensive diner-style brunch. From the reviews, the oatmeal pancakes were highly reviewed. I got that and wasn't disappointed. Had the taste and relative healthiness of oatmeal, but the texture of pancakes, topped with strawberries. The house coffee was also better than your average diner coffee. I loved the reasonable prices the most.
author: Will H.

description:
Delicious breakfast!

I was craving mexican food for breakfast (i'm from LA, hits me hard sometimes), and no not something from a place called "tacolicious" or some other suspect-sounding mexican place. We came here immediately after the climbing gym. I left with my craving satisfied. 

i ordered the carne deshilada, and stole my partner's green salsa from his breakfast burrito. I had a hard time choose because i seriously wanted to eat like 4 different dishes (platanos, chilaquiles, pancakes...), but i remember my plate being flavorful and everything I wanted at the moment. Partner killed his burrito with no complaints. 

Service was fine, got everything we needed and I hope to come back soon!
author: Antoinnae C.

description: It's your standard brunch fare, but walk down 24th St to Noe Valley, and the quality is simply better: more fresh, more variety, and higher quality ingredients.
author: Stephanie T.

description:
I really enjoyed this place, nice BIG portions. Came here with my boyfriend and his dad. (His dad lives in the area ) WE LOVE IT!! They are currently coming here everyday and I come when ever I hit the city. To bad there is nothing similar to this in Oakland or San Leandro. It is also cheaper then Missions Kitchen. 

FOOD - I nibbled on my boyfriend's plate, and the pancakes are nice and soft, almost like Ole's Waffle Shop in Alameda . His dad always gets a chicken sandwich with salad. I get the supreme omelette, it has a combination of ham, sausage, and bacon (For all the meat lovers)

Orange Juice is freshly made. 

Service is good.
author: Monserrat M.

description: Great quick feed!  Clean,  friendly,  coffee never got low and French toast was perfect.   What else could you ask for?
author: B M.

description: Solid basic breakfast and lunch place. The onion rings are amazing but if the "house made corned beef" didn't come out of a can I'll eat a bug.
author: Manny F.

description:
Gallo pinto, queso fresco y maduros fritos for breakfast along with a cup of cafe con leche, all the goodness that evokes memories of abuelita.

 This is the place to go to when you want comfort with your coffee.
author: Darth M.

description: Fast friendly service. Had the egg white scramble with veggies and hash browns, delicious and fresh. Cappuccino was on point as well.
author: Tori W.

description:
What can I say? I love a good meal, good solid service and great value. 

Red Café checks all those boxes! I grew up in the Mission and how I never found this place in a previous life beats me. I'm a hog for chiliquiles and this place just does it right. They were probably the best I've had because instead of being doused in sauce, the tortillas (which were spectacular) held up and really gave a great textural contrast. My mom and aunt got shredded flank steak breakfast...the name escapes me but it was damn good. The steak was seasoned perfectly and the tortillas (corn and flour) that they brought with it was warm and perfect. My other aunt got the grilled chicken and eggs and that was pretty solid as well. 

This place got packed pretty quickly. I don't blame them seeing the tasty morsels they were dishing out! As all places in the Mission, especially for brunch, I recommend getting in early, lets just say 9am or so to snag a table before the rush starts.

I'll definitely be back the next time I'm back home!
author: Shy A.

description:
I've been going to Red Café consistently, at least a couple times a month, for the last five years and I cannot believe this is my first yelp review for them! Maybe I was too busy eating some of their delicious meals to actually take the time to write something! Lol...
Honestly I have never had a bad meal at this place there was a point in time they actually had Pupusa(the Salvadorian dish) that was amazing and then I guess the person that made them no longer works there, but aside from that everything else has been soooo good from the Chilaquiles breakfast, to the Plantain breakfast to the American plates & they even have a delish Veggie burger made in house! Honestly, I can say their service is great in house or take out, you cannot go wrong. The staff is super sweet, polite & timely. I'm a fan!
author: Jasmine A.

description:
This is a great no-frills diner with American And Mexican options for breakfast and lunch!

While our 30 minute wait today (a Sunday morning around 11:00am) to be seated was a drag, the meal hit the spot!  My fiancé's chilaquiles were delicious, and my vegetarian omelette was tasty and loaded with veggies.  The toast and hash browns that came with my omelette were pretty standard.

The service was polite and friendly, and the food came out quickly.

We'll be back!
author: Barnali D.

description:
This place is horrible, bad food and even worse service!!
-garbage in my ice cup for my warm soda can
-watery flavorless food
-rude, stick up her butt server who threw trash on my full plate when I asked for a box.


 We came in for the first time and were handed menus with no smile or hello then within 1 minute the server came for our order. I said I wasn't ready. Less than a minute later she returned asking for our order again, my husband ordered chilequilles because he felt a sense of urgency then she looked at me and I said "you can put his order in if you need to but I'm not ready" she gave me a bitchy look and walked away. At that, I was now being punished. She didn't look at us or return for about 10 minutes. During the wait I walked my husbands empty coffee cup up to the counter where all the waitresses were gossiping and was given an astonished look by them. When she finally returned to take my order, she brought my husbands plate! Obviously we did't REALLY WANT to eat separately. She was just being a bit**. She asked me if I was ready now with a completely unamused look. I ordered huevos rancheros and asked to have rice instead of hashbrowns. She mumbled some strange thing to me about an extra wait and I said "you have to cook the rice or something?" And she said "we have no substitutions!" So I said "Ohhh you mean like you charge more for rice instead of hashbrowns?" And she said yes so I said just give me the hashbrowns, as the price was already ridiculously high ($9). My husbands chilequilles was not made correctly, was skimpy and came with a cup of beans so watery you needed a straw. Our server walked behind the counter and was clearly talking about me to her coworker, it was soo obvious, I was pretty confused about what exactly I'd done to offend her cuz it happened within seconds of us walking in. My husband finished his food and about 5 mins later mine arrived. I gave her back the warm canned soda she had given me because I didn't want to drink it warm nor did I want to use the cup of ice that had a crumpled used sugar packet tossed in the bottom under the ice. She shot me a dirty look and walked away. My food was inedible. It was water soup. The eggs were ok but covered in canned tomato sauce and a pool of water, the same water-consistency beans and some soggy bland, oily hashbrowns oh and some really bad, cold tortillas. When she came back 10 minutes after I took 3 bites of food and put my SPOON down (yes I had to use a spoon) she grabbed my plate and said "u finished" I said "can I have a box?" because I didn't want to waste an entire plate of food, I could probably doctor it up at home. She tossed a wrapper and a salsa cup on my plate an turned around so I scoffed "umm ok" and she said "what" and I said "I asked u to box that" and she said "do u want another one?" So I said no because I didn't want whatever slop she was planning on spitting in. She brought the bill and didn't even discount it. She threw trash on my full plate of food that I wanted to-go!  I wanted to talk to a manager but all the people working there appeared to be waitresses and cooks so I'm sure talking to anybody else wouldn't have done anything. We gave her a $2 tip on a $20 bill, my husband put down $4 but I took $2 away and put it I. My purse because she didn't deserve ANYTHING! I'm so annoyed that we even left $2! My husband agreed that she didn't deserve anything but he doesn't care about money so he would just have soon left her a good tip. 
In a nutshell this horrible server took out money and threw my full plate of food in the garbage. Never again. Mission's kitchen is soooo much better even on their worst day!
author: Emma H.

description:
Let me start by saying this place used to be amazing.  It had the best coffee and fresh dishes cooked to perfection with highly attentive staff. Over the last three months we noticed a lot of changes in staff and service.  We used to crave this meal and made it a weekly visit.  Now I would not recommend a visit or even consider it as my top 3 choices for a meal. 

Some examples of the decline is most of the staff is standing behind the counter while the tables are full and not serving patrons refills on coffee or drinks. My last visit I actually had to get up and bring my cup to the counter just for a refill and they did not even seem embarrassed or offer an apology.  Huge decline in service and attention to detail.  The staff needs to really take the initiative and ensure the patrons are being  served. This is probably the second biggest let down since the last 3 months. 

The first biggest let down is the change in quality of food. The ingredients are still fresh and delicious but the food is coming out burnt or overcooked. I ordered chilaquiles and got basically a bag of cooked tortilla chips with one egg. It was not gross but greatly deminished in quality and taste. My girlfriend ordered an omlete with bacon and cheese and the egg was burned and brown and super dry. These are huge no nos in the restaurant business.  Highly disappointed in the declinethe staff offered to remake the food but by this time we were tired of the wait and so disappointed it was easier to take the food to go and give it to the homeless. 

Overall this place used to be a 5 star establishment but now I am sure the drop brings it to only 2 1/2 stars. For the price wait and quality I would suggest to keep looking for another place for breakfast because reds cafe is on a slippery slope down to 1 star.
author: Roman R.

description:
Admittedly based on one visit, but a disappointing experience.  The food we got was good, but the service was abysmal.  One of our group got something other than what he ordered, but instead of rectifying the situation, the waitress argued with him and the other 3 of us who heard his order.  Then when faced with the opportunity to admit 4 people were probably right, she brought in reinforcements (other employees) to help her disagree with our collective memory.

Orders get messed up - that's not insurmountable.  Mounting a defense to prolong just doing the right thing is a shitteous customer service tactic.  Especially for a basic omelette.  Probably wont go back as the food would have had to have been life-altering to make up for the crap service.
author: Michael T.

description:
Affordable ($7-$10) Mexican and american breakfast and brunch/lunch diner...in the city!? Too good. I got the combination, pancakes, 2 eggs, and 3 sausages for $8. Everything was yumz. Santa fe omelette and breakfast quesadilla were yumz too. 

Went at 8:30am on sat and avoided the line.
author: Sarah W.

description:
Not only can you get your typical breakfast fare but then there is the heavenly delicious Plantanos con casamiento... Check out my picture capturing the moment!  They also have espresso & make a nice cappuccino (added bonus for espresso lovers like me).

The food is consistently good and I never leave without a smile on my face!

The staff is friendly and provides great service! I will keep coming back !
author: Naz a.

description: Used to like this place but not after this. Ordered a chicken sandwich and as I was biting the meat just felt too hard and too raw. I called the place and they didn't want to give me a refund. They wanted to give me the same meal putting myself at risk of getting raw meat again. Plus the manager Sofia was a bit too rude. Never ordering from this place again.
author: María F.

description:
Food relly good except the host lady is so mean she looks like she doesn't like what she does except when a Caucasian comes meaning been descriminative  with Spanish speakers customer .
I got there say hello she totally ignored me she needs to improve her customer service wether is white or people of color we all deserve the same respect.
author: Sandra Z.

description:
We really enjoyed this little family owned cafe, we weren't sure about how to order Mexican breakfast but were thoroughly glad of the recommendations. 

After three months, I'm back, their handmade tortillas are a real hit. I enjoyed every bit of my order.
author: SJ L.

description: Came here at 2:30pm on a sunny Sun. They were very fast. It took them 10 min to prepare my poached egg with beef. The food is delicious ! And it's clean here!
author: Ming-Hen T.

description: Exemplary restaurant business!  The service is top-notch! Friendly waiters and great chefs. The food is always tasty and out in no time! Love this little spot in the mission! Latina owned and ran business!
author: J M.

description: This place is a great find. Looks not so great from the outside, but this is your typical abundant breakfast place. We loved it. First time we had the pancake mix plate with eggs and sausages - yummy and the portions were pretty big we couldn't finish our pancakes which were huge hahaha. 2nd time we were meeting friends for breakfast so we immediately remembered our lovely experience in this place and took our friends there. I can't get over how many healthy and creative choices their menu has - they have vegan, vegetarian, healthy meat options, avocado in your omelette or mexican style eggs so all four of us ordered different type of eggs and they were all delicious choices - i don't think there's anything you can go wrong with the menu chocies. What more would you want from life? Oh yes they serve fresh orange juice and is delicious. Take your appetite there NOW! Did I mention this place is totally affordable as well?
author: Heliana M.

description:
For the price you pay, you get a semi-decent amount of food. It's very small inside and there are always neighborhood hipsters packing the place.

Excellent service form the staff. They really welcome you and follow up to make sure your okay.
author: Cesar P.

description: I have been a frequent here for about 7 years The staff are absolutely sweet and attentive, the food is to die for and every dish on the menu is heavenly delishhhhh....Cant never go wrong with Red Cafe
author: Michelle V.

description: My favorite cheap, consistent, go to breakfast spot. The wait has gotten longer over the years, but the food has never disappointed. Very friendly and attentive service, highly recommend the French toast or chilaquiles!
author: Clarice W.

description: This place is great for a quick small group to eat. I had the corn beef hash with poached eggs. It was delicious and quick.
author: Gabriela H.

description: The food was probably the worst I've had at a breakfast place. I mean it was edible sure but I couldn't finish anything. It wasn't cheap either I'd give it two money signs. Would not recommend and I hardly rate anything under 4.
author: Ryan C.

description: The Carne Deshilada and Corn Beef Hash with Poached Eggs are my favorites. The staff are all super friendly. It gets busy, but if you're solo it's pretty easy to get a seat at the counter without a wait.
author: Justin Y.

description:
Like... it's okay?

Don't get the hype and raving reviews. It's got a nice homey vibe with lots of regulars, but the line for the food that came out? I got the breakfast quesadilla and it was really buttery and greasy, and not something I would seek out again. The wait staff and service people are super nice so I don't like to leave a negative review, but the food was run of the mill, and not very good run of the mill.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Red Cafe is basically fine.  I've been there a few times with a few people, and ordered a variety of Mexican and American dishes.  Nothing has super impressed me, but nothing's been horribly bad either.  The prices are okay.  On weekends the wait can be somewhat long, but still better than a lot of places in the Mission.

So, fine if you need a place to go for breakfast, but don't expect to be blown away.
author: Victoria P.

description: Great coffee. Awesome and friendly service. Worth the wait in line. I ordered two buttermilk pancakes with banana. It's delicious!
author: Ming M.

description: I hate to write this review because I am a mission native and I have gone to red cafe more than 30x but I went today and got the chicken Cesar salad and I actually just got done throwing up . Definitely gave me food poisoning I feel like going to the bathroom again for the 3rd x . I knew the chicken wasn't cooked right . Definitely disappointed they were one of my favorite places to eat but I not going back .
author: Yanet P.

description:
Many reviewers have talked about the oatmeal pancakes...but what's one more? They are DELICIOUS! Better than regular pancakes, better than regular oatmeal - the best of both worlds, a whole greater than the sum of its parts. Synergistic, if you will. 

Oh, and they use REAL eggs, not powdered eggs that a lot of places use to cut costs. You can get your eggs every which way but a somewhat unsual way (as far as traditional diners go) is eggs a la mexicana, and eggs a la salvadorena. The former has jalapeno, the latter does not.

Service is fast, food comes out quick, the only down side is if you sit at the bar near the griddle it gets a bit toasty and your clothes smell like breakfast, which may or may not be so bad...
author: Polly F.

description:
I was so indecisive about what I wanted for breakfast  and of course I went to yelp to help me. I knew I was in the mood for salvadorean food but still wanted french toast (doesnt get more indecisive than that right?) So I came here and and  boy am I glad I did! I shared a plate of platanos  con casamiento and a french toast-it was more than enough. The fresh squeezed orange was amazingly fresh. I also went  with a true salvadorean and it got their stamp of their approval.

The service and food  was so good and authentic. I have no complaints and I  know that I will be back. 

I obviously came at the perfect time because i was seated right away but i did see a few wait a few moments.
author: Amari C.

description:
Hands down, the best breakfast spot in the Mission. 

Sit at the counter and watch them hustle while you stuff your face with chilaquiles...

The End. You're welcome.
author: Lauren B.

description:
You're kidding me about the Corned Beef Hash sandwich, right? Oh come on. It sounds like something I would make out of desperation because I ran out of bologna and was too lazy to go to the 7-11 and get some. Sure enough, they serve it here in a French roll for $6.95, and it tastes like it came from a can of Mary Kitchen, which is not a bad thing if you ask me. They put in a scrambled egg, lettuce, tomato and plenty of mayo. It came with some thick onion rings that were crunchy-greasy-good (see photo). 

Jamie W. didn't fare as well with the $6.25 House Burger (see photo). While the meat patty was good enough, he said the bacon tasted pretty stale and chewy, and the fries were not too satisfying considering how many of the onion rings he tried to pilfer off my plate. The pupusa was probably the least controversial item on our respective plates. Not made with the tender mamacita hands to be found at El Zocalo, they were decent enough at $1.99 each. Mine had mushrooms and cheese inside (see photo), and it was the only hint that we were in the Mission. 

Service was on the tentative side like he wasn't sure when to come back to pick up plates or refill glasses. Instead, he simply stared at us from a distance. Regardless, I like the dinerish set-up here (see photo) and could see myself coming back for breakfast. They offer Mexican food but don't seem to emphasize it given the number of taquerias in the vicinity including the one we were intending to visit, La Taqueria, which was overstuffed with waiting customers across the street. 

FOOD - 3 stars...corned beef hash sandwich? 
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...semi-old-fashioned diner with a counter and semi-private booths 
SERVICE - 3 stars...on the tentative side 
TOTAL - 3 stars...greasy spoonish option in the Mission with some Latin color
author: Ed U.

description:
Went on Sunday around 10. They said 20 min wait, but got seated much quicker. Service was super quick and very friendly. The food came out incredibly fast considering the restaurant was full.
What we liked:
Beans were very tasty, if a little thin
Salsas were very good
Eggs were good
Pancakes were very good
Even though the overall vibe was toward Mexican food, the standard diner fare was excellent.
We would definitely go back if in the neighborhood, but probably wouldn't cross town to go there.
author: Don H.

description:
In my opinion, GREAT for hangovers. I ordered the chilaquiles (based on several Yelps) and I did not regret it. It hit the spot perfectly. It came with a side of (liquified) beans, guac, and sour cream. I just sort of dumped everything together and ate it all up. 

Service here was prompt and friendly. The food was delicious. The hardest part was deciding what to order. If I'm ever in the area again, I will definitely try the plantains that so many people raved about. The only thing lacking was that this place wasn't quite as inexpensive as lots of people claimed. It was $8.99 for the chilaquiles, which doesn't break the bank by any means, but I was expecting cheaper. Ah well. Pay for what you get. The food was yummy!
author: Melissa F.

description: Awesome place. Good service. Up there with the best breakfast burritos I've ever had!!
author: Matt M.

description: The food was good but the temperature wasn't as hot as it should be. We ordered the chilaquiles and meaty omelet. The omelet had amazing amounts of meat piled in but the cheese on top was cold by the time it got to the table. The chilaquiles had good flavor, but was barely warm as well. I'd try it again and sit closer to the bar to hopefully get our food faster. Crossing fingers that the next time we eat there, the food is hot.
author: Marlene T.

description: I don't know about you but I don't typically see Chilaqiles on the menu..this place has them and they are the best I have ever had and come with more than what you could ask for. If you are hungry want a delicious meal like the kind your mom would make you on a Sunday morning and on top of that pay less than what you thought this wonderful meal truly deserves...come here and ordered the Chilaqiles you won't be disappointed.
author: Ana L.

description: For the price you can't beat it! The atmosphere is just ok, and the food is pretty good.. The waitresses are super nice. Try the chicken sandwich! The chicken is so perfectly cooked.. Fries need some seasoning though.
author: William J.

description: I am glad I found this place today, I came in for a nice breakfast and I was pleased to find out that this place serves fresh squeezed orange juice. it is rare for a restaurant to serve fresh orange juice now in days. Yeah they charge for refill but who doesn't now in days especially when its fresh squeezed orange juice. I ordered their supreme omelet and that was more than satisfied.  My grandmother ordered the fried plantain with their refried beans, she is a picky eater and she loved it. I'm glad to say I found my new spot.
author: Hershey R.

description:
Very good place, i been  eating breakfast  for a couple of years, and I'm  still happy  with the sevice
Food its exelent, 
I highly recommend
author: FerPro C.

description:
I have returned a few more times and had a different scrambler: the Country Scrambler with ham, avocado and jack cheese. On one day the scrambler came with melted jack but on another it's not melted. Half of an avocado sits on top of the scramble, which I dice and mix with the fluffy eggs and ham. The four corn tortillas were steamy hot to touch, wrapped snugly in foil. I usually assemble my own little tacos. Taste of heaven! I can never finish the has brown and I have to watch how much carb I eat. 

This place is solid. Staff is friendly. My waitress came by a few times to check on me and refilled my coffee. I happened to sit in the same booth too.

Now that I have tried Jim's, I can say Red Cafe is not in the same league in the delicious varieties of breakfast plates that it offers. Jim's isn't substantially cheaper so I'll be back to Red Cafe if I'm in the Mission.

Country scrambler with coffee $10
author: Matt Y.

description: Red Cafe exemplifies pre-gentrification Mission dining: affordable, tasty, filling food without all the frills. Though our wait was minimal, there was a sizable line when we left. All of us enjoyed our meals, however wait staff can be a bit slow taking your order.
author: David R.

description:
Really solid breakfast food and REAL FRESH SQUEEZED ORANGE JUICE HOLY GOOD GOD.

The service was kinda terrible when I was there, but I don't care, it was really good and probably a one off thing. I got a two egg breakfast with french toast and bacon and it was great. 

Worth the visit.
author: Jimmy H.

description: This establishment exceeded my expectations. It was delicious and very affordable. I had the house burger and let me tell you, it was incredible. The meat was cooked to perfection and seasoned well. The fries are also very good and crunchy. If u are near and looking for good atmosphere and great food come to this cafe, I highly recommend it.
author: Saul E.

description:
I really miss the Chicken Farmer.  I'm sure I could find her, or maybe she finally moved to New Orleans.

One of the things I like about living in San Francisco is that it's easy to find people, but it's easy to lose them as well.  Almost every other month, I see people I know at random spots:  on BART, crossing Fillmore Street, getting off the 24-Divisadero at McAllister.  I recognize many more people constantly.  And while it is nice to reconnect with old friends, it's also nice to just acknowledge acquaintances with a smile.  No need to go down the rabbit hole of social convention, because, honestly, do I really care what the foreperson from my month-long jury trial is up to now?  I know he lives a block away from me, and it was nice to see him, but I don't need to follow him on Twitter or hang out with him and his girlfriend or check out his new motorcycle.

Red Cafe is really good.  The vegetarian options are good for a Mission breakfast place that's actually in the Mission--on Mission Street, not in one of the hipster Bantustans.

The place is hopping, but the service is up to the task.  The counter is way too cramped, so don't sit there, especially in the middle.  There should be windows onto 25th Street, but I assume this space used to be a store, and they didn't want thieves to have too many ways to break in.  But forget about everything related to the decor.  It's really good, and it's clean, from open kitchen to tables to bathrooms.  It's a little pricier than I thought it would be, but big portions mean it's a decent value.

So thank you, Chicken Farmer.  I hope all your injuries are healing well.  Know that you have at least two loyal fans:  me and Tim, whom I haven't seen since I randomly spotted him on a southbound BART train about a year ago.  Did you know he played rugby at Georgetown?  Here's to running into people you like randomly.  Cheers!
author: John S.

description: When I came in for breakfast the small cafe was packed. It was a little confusing at first as there were no staff to greet you when you initially walked in. However the food was quick and fresh and wasn't too expensive. It was good but nothing amazing.
author: Michael C.

description:
I wanted to come back and I did... the next morning! I'm just obviously a bit delayed in writing the second review. Just as with the first time at Red Cafe, it was a solid and positive experience. The staff are absolutely sweet and attentive. The waiter from the previous morning, Mauricio, recognized me and we chatted for a little bit. I felt that even though I was in SF for just a week, I had become a bit of a local regular ;)

As for food, I tried the huevos rancheros (with homemade salsa, refried beans and hash browns), and got sourdough toast to go with it. The two eggs were cooked over-easy and perfect, in my opinion. The homemade salsa on top of the eggs was delicious too. Mixed with the refried beans and hash browns, it was a perfect blend of flavors and textures. And when I broke the egg whites, a perfectly gooey egg yolk ran out, into which I dipped my sourdough toast. Happiness.

Another great breakfast experience. If/when I come back to SF again, I'll definitely come back here!
author: Anna S.

description:
This place is amazing unless u can get over the lack of ait conditioning lol 
My boyfriend and I came here on a whim and loved it. The food was amazing. Big filling portions.  Freshly made food and as a restarant worker I love going into a place where the staff is laid back and can relax. Habing to walk on egg shells all the time is 99.9% of the reason people fet bad service. So great staff. Great food. Great surroundings. Go! Now!!!
author: Ashley S.

description: Always friendly and attentive staff even though the whole place is packed and it's a zoo. I usually find myself feeling at home sitting at the bar and just being part of this commotion. Pretty good food as well. Don't be afraid to try some of the Mexican dishes, if it looks good and you see people eating it, then chances are it's good. But if you want to to stick to the familiar then the pancakes here are nice.
author: Charles L.

description: One of my favorite spots in mission love the food nice cozy place for brunch and lunch, friendly staff
author: Medi M.

description: One of my favorite breakfast and lunch spots!! The chilaquiles is nice and crunchy and yummy
author: Jacqueline M.

description:
Who knew oatmeal pancakes could taste this good?

Service was friendly and I gotta come back for the fried plantain plate with beans rice and sour cream, it looked amazing!
author: Letitia L.

description: If it wasn't for the hair in my brothers plate of food, it was great. Seems like a local favorite and has tasty food and reasonable prices. Tight spaces and a single bathroom right next to a table (that's gross). However, I'll come here every time I'm in SF despite those issues. Kinda makes it feel like home
author: Bryan K.

description: The food was all tasty, but they tried to overcharge us and argued against the pricing that was on the menu, which was frustrating. Maybe it was a one-off; I hope so. Pretty small spot but at 9:30 am on a Saturday, we got a table for 4 within minutes. So go for it, just make sure to read the bill before you blindly pay it.
author: Amanda I.

description: I come here a lot, and thought I would show my friend from out of town one of my go to spot. Unfortunately today was not one of their good days. I ordered eggs la Mexicana or something like that with a side of fried plantains my friend ordered the French toast. The French toast was under cooked and soggy before syrup was put on it. We informed our server about this and she took it back to the kitchen, where they didn't make a new one they just threw it back on the grill. When we got the French toast back it was still soggy.  We had pushed the plate to the front of the table and our server didn't even acknowledge that it hadn't been touched. When she did final ask us if everything was ok we said it wasn't she said ooh ok and walked away. I'm really sad that this happen.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: Portions were big.  Food was kinda greasy.
author: Mitch L.

description: I never feel compelled to rate businesses but Red Cafe has been the exception. I was hosting my sister from San Diego and we were walking around on a Sunday morning after our first brunch plans fell through. We stumbled upon this place and decided to check it out.
