There was 2 or 3 parties waiting outside but we were addressed immediately as we walked up. They said 15 min wait time, we were sat in 5. Given our drinks immediately, (the entire place was full) and our orders were taken as soon as we were ready. The owner/GM even refilled our waters. I have worked many food service jobs and it was clear that the entire staff cared about our experience. Not only we were treated with kindness, our dishes were delicious and CHEAP, especially for the Mission... they could double their prices and that place would still do business. Felt like a piece of home eating here and I will definitely be back.
author: Carlee K.

description:
I must share my recent discovery. The Red Café!

Small clean diner with friendly staff. Delicious food at reasonable prices. My only complaint: poor ventilation. It got hot and stuffy.

And the Santa Fe omelet? Oooooh myyyy!

Chorizo, broccoli, bell peppers, and mushrooms. Served with a side of hash browns and choice of toast or tortilla. Soooo goooood!! I swear they sprinkled crack in it since I couldn't stop eating it even though I wasn't hungry. 

Eventually my stomach couldn't take anymore. Got a piece of foil, wrapped the omelet and hash brown in the tortilla. Crack burrito to go! 

My first Mexican brunch experience and I loved it. Will be back for more!
author: Marti L.

description:
This is a great place for breakfast and brunch! Friendly staff, quick service, and authentic Salvadoran food! 

Order the platanos con casamiento!
author: Lauren U.

description: Awesome diner experience. Lots of choices, yummy food a good 'ol fashioned friendly, casual diner service!
author: Pauline K.

description: We looooove this local spot!! Best friendly staff. Fresh fast food. Amazing chiliquiles, hash browns and beautiful lattes.
author: Bernice B.

description: I LOVE this place. It is super cheap, super fast, and has amazing service. Best brunch spot in the mission and Hayes Valley combined.
author: Shaquille H.

description: $10 for tea, two eggs, toast, hashbrowns, and sausage. Decent size, not huge by any standards, but it was solid and ridiculously fast (less than three minutes after I ordered, I had my food). Service was excellent as well. Not a wow-write-home-to-mommy meal. Still lovely!
author: Bonny A.

description: Great service, really tasty chilaquiles and oatmeal pancakes. Definitely a neighborhood go-to from now on.
author: Carmella D.

description: My favorite spot for a simple and reliable breakfast. Nice family working there. Always busy but never too too busy.
author: Matt W.

description: Great place to go for an inexpensive meal. Very attentive staff and great tasting food. I highly recommend going here. It is a lot of food, so you may not even finish it. But you won't regret coming here.
author: Mario C.

description: My weekday morning spot, it's always light and airy in here..pretty solid coffee for a neighborhood diner kinda thing and the food is equally tasty. Can't complain, it's all peachy..
author: Lucy F.

description:
very small denver omelet with one slice of cheese on top. 
i asked for crispy hashbrowns and got them mushy. 
i asked if the corned beef was from a can, was told no.... it was.
author: Michael C.

description:
The service here is phenomenal! The manager or owner made rounds every few minutes and kept his staff on point! 

The sourdough bread... TO DIE FOR - could eat it all day. 
The hash browns were soggy but supreme!
French toast was bomb.
The water was a little disappointing but we chugged through. 

Overall a really fabulous experience.
author: Adam S.

description: Been coming here for as long as i can remember. Service is good. Food is great. Place is very small, wish they had a bigger location. Also there might be a wait time since its sooo small but its worth it!
author: Claudia R.

description: Not sure about the food but the mannerism of the older lady with the blondish/brown hair that works there is crap!! Someone needs to teach her how to speak to customers and be more respectful. The food looks pretty decent though so that is a plus....
author: Tata R.

description:
This place was quite decent. It's not terribly healthy, but other yelpers were right: get the orange juice (fresh-squeezed), and expect it to be a diner atmosphere. 

Overall, the food was good, but not amazing. We had the oatmeal pancakes (I would prefer if they were a little more firm on the outside) and the chilaquiles. The chilaquiles were tasty, with crispy tortilla (great texture) and the salsa verde was very good. 

I'm not rushing to go back, but if I'm in the neighborhood, a perfectly respectable option.
author: Sam Z.

description: I happily started my day with the corned beef hash. It came with two softly poached eggs. I initially asked if I could get the cooked medium because I prefer the whites cookes but the yolk to run, but they call that soft here. Instead of toast or tortilla, I opted for fruit which were strawberry and banana slices. I enjoyed the tender and seasoned corned beef, the mildy crispy potatoes and the random bit of sautéed onions and green bell peppers in the hash.
author: Wella A.

description: Bad greasy food- stay away! My husband and I went for breakfast there and were disappointed.
author: Lila R.

description:
Please work on your ventilation.  Food was okay...nothing to brag about... Portions were just right.  I'd recommend the fried plantains plus rice/beans mix.  

One let down were the over cooked poached eggs.  They came out hard boiled.  

Final note I don't care too much about their mess but sanitation sure can improve.
author: Koalie W.

description: I always forget about this place, but man - what a fantastic breakfast!!  Proper huevos Rancheros. Perfect hashbrowns. Delicious refried beans.  Fresh squeezed orange juice. And very nice staff!
author: Daniel W.

description: My experience at this cafe was not good.  First of all, the server took at least 10 minutes to even approach our table.  We both requested orange juice.  it tasted like rotten oranges had been used to make the "fresh" juice.  The after-taste was just plain nasty.  I ordered a country scramble that was fine but nothing worth writing a positive review about.  It lacked any real flavor and the shredded potatoes were undercooked and bland.  My friend also noted that his oatmeal pancakes and fried eggs had no flavor  I have lived around the corner from the cafe since it opened but it was my first visit. And my last.  I can make the same food at home for 1/3 the price and give it flavor.  A real disappointment.
author: James S.

description:
If you're looking for a Michelin Star breakfast that comes with a garnish for your gluten free pancakes, this is not the place for you. I don't understand why people come here expecting to have some gourmet pretentious meal and then give this establishment a low rating when that's not what they get.

Red Cafe is a no frills, greasy spoon breakfast that comes at affordable, pre-tech San Francisco prices. The staff hustles and respects anyone that understands that. The food is great and one of the few places you can find just regular old hash browns, bacon, and eggs. But their huevos rancheros is where it's at. 

I hope this place stays around for a long time because it's the bees knees!
author: katrina t.

description: The food here is pretty good but i was stunned when we received the bill. They charged us $1.79 to remove bell peppers from an omelette. Not only did they not tell us before putting it on the bill, we only found out after asking directly what the charge on the bill was. I've worked in relaxed fine dining for over a decade and this is the most ridiculous charge I've ever heard of. Yes, they may have prediced the omelette vegetables but they shouldn't charge you to cut them fresh and if they insist on that, they should inform you before putting it on the bill. Unbelievably unimpressed.
author: Dylan L.

description:
I've had breakfast hear at least eight times.  Food is always great, and the service is pretty fast.  I've had their eggs & beans & chilaquiles a few times, as well as their waffles (very generous with the fruit, which is awesome) - the servings are plenty big to fill you up, and the prices are very reasonable. One day (on a weekend), there were even live musicians playing, which was a cool surprise.  
Only criticism - some of the items on the menu are ambiguous whether the portion (and price) is an appetizer or main dish, so make sure to clarify, otherwise you'll likely get the larger & more expensive one.
author: bret s.

description: I been coming here for years with my family. Staff is friendly but it can get very busy on the weekends. I only come her for breakfast and order the casamiento or chilaquiles.
author: Johanna P.

description: Blah!! This place is horrible. I order an omelette and the cheese still had a piece of the paper it comes with. Everything was horrible. Don't waste your money and go somewhere else..
author: Chiara M.

description: Good local diner with great omelette options. Very accomodating for families!
author: So N.

description:
I LOVE Red Cafe!!!! Why you ask?  It's not because of the crappy paint job, or the smelly bathroom, or the dirty surroundings, or the slow checks.....this place is so chill you could freeze a glass of water here.

The staff here is always friendly and accommodating.  The food is...well let's say you'll want to avoid some things....here's what I know about Red Cafe so far...

-Do not eat burgers there...they use American cheese....the burgers are generally "meh"
-They have awesome fried plantains and black beans
-Awesome Chilaquiles
-Awesome  Huevos Rancheros 
-Good Pancakes

Essentially, if you order any Comida Mexicana you're gonna have a good time.
author: Kat D.

description: Cutest little hole in the wall. I didn't know it was mexican cafe when I walked in. They have everything from amazing breakfast to dinner plates. I had the fajitas and they were amazing. Colorful platter of veggies and the chicken was deliciously seasoned!  Everyone was so nice and the food fast.
author: Juli P.

description: Consistently solid, greasy spoon food joint. Service is always friendly. The prices are right and it always hits the spot.   One of the few places I frequent in this city.
author: Anna V.

description: I've come here for brunch a few times for solid food and quick service. The food is pretty greasy, but yummy--good for a hangover. I really enjoyed my huevos rancheros which was a huge portion that I could not finish. This is a no frills restaurant that hasn't had a wait when I've gone which is a plus since sometimes finding a brunch/breakfast spot where you don't have a to wait an hour can be hard in this city!
author: Natalia K.

description:
On New Year's Day we decided to head over to SF and check out the mission district. After getting coffee and a local coffee joint, we decided to head over to the Red Cafe for brunch.

I ordered the eggs rancheros over easy with corn tortillas. The sauce was spicy and the beans runny. The eggs were cooked just right. The first couple of bites i thought the food was just okay. However, it grew on me the more bites I took. It was especially good when I sopped it all up with my tortillas.

My wife ordered the home made corned beef hash with poached eggs and sourdough toast. The corned beef hash was kinda sour and vinegary and the eggs were overcooked. I didn't care for it at first, but like my dish, the more I ate it the more I liked it.
author: Danna C.

description: Really bad service, the manager Sofia gave bad customer service, didnt give my coworker a refund for a raw chicken sandwich and didnt want to give the money back just because it was in a credit card! and didnt want to refund the whole order becuase it was going to mess up her count and wanted to give me the half of another chicken sandwich, and she even told us but if you get it chicken again it can be raw as well so would you like turkey? and i said no we want our money back wich she did not give us at all!! bad bad bad customer service!
author: Portillo G.

description: I don't know how this place has 4 stars on Yelp. The food was good, not great. My egg was overlooked, but everything else was fine. The service however was slow and inattentive. My mom ordered a decaf coffee and it took them 10 minutes to get it to her. We also ordered water for the three of us and they only brought two waters. My mom also ordered the country scramble that on the menu said came with avocado. Only it didn't come with avocado and when my mom asked where it was, they said "sorry we don't have any left." The reason she ordered it was for the avocado. Moreover, there was someone in the booth directly behind me who kept pushing back on the booth chair, causing mine to move forward unexpectedly over and over again. Lastly, I unfortunately sat in front of the restroom door and all I saw all brunch was a toilet as so many people opened and closed the door walking in and out of the restroom. I will not be back.
author: Angela B.

description: All the stars I'm given are for the food quality. The service was very poor. We got "greeted" quick. We had to ask for our table to be clean. Anyway, the food was delicious. I ordered a steak and eggs combo. It came really good hash browns. The stake was tender and easy to eat with great flavor. My eggs came out the way I wanted them. The coffee was okay.  I would definitely recommend this place if your looking for great food. Don't expect a lot from service.
author: Papi R.

description: Here again and ordering the Garden Omelette. Still a place that isnt crowded at 0820 on a Saturday but you better hurry.
author: Kevin L.

description:
The service is good! Greeted, seated and spoken to in Spanish... answered back in English and wasn't looked down on ;) Live music in the morning, nice way to start the day. 

Oatmeal pancakes, Carne Deshilada (shredded beef, tomatoes, green chiles egg scramble, side of rice and hash browns), and a side of platanos and tortillas. All good and satisfying!
author: S Y.

description: I have to say red cafe blew my mind away! The first time I dined here was with my husband I ordered a oatmeal pancake which were phenomenal! We both ordered an orange juice, the purest orange juice I've ever tasted the taste was tangy and sweet. My husband ordered ( pickiest eater alive) ordered a chicken Caesar salad. As he was eating his eyes brightened and looked amazed, I thought to myself " another plate he doesn't like what am I going to do " turned he like it so much he ordered another one for lunch the next day. By far my new favorite spot
author: Cindy M.

description: It's a 3.5 star kinda place. Decent food (I had combo breakfast) with bacon and side of english muffin + coffee.  Coffee was good, free refills as you would expect. Pancakes were bigger than expected and just fine. Eggs ordered over easy and were just a hair towards over-medium (not runny at all and yolk solidified in a couple spots). Bacon was a thicker cut and more pieces than other places. And even at noon on Saturday I was able to get a counter seat for 1 with no wait. Staff was super nice, attentive and fast. Interior was clean without being 'plastic-y'- somewhere between Mission dive and Denny's. Closer to Denny's. :) $14 plus tip. All in all a solid Mission breakfast place.
author: Chris P.

description:
In today's fast-paced tech start-up society, it's an irony that we're waiting around small, dainty restaurants waiting for our turn to order an overpriced miniature brioche. That's why I like Red Cafe and its simple, understated pragmatics.

Just get your eggs and move on.

I've gone on Sunday mornings around 9 when there is no line. I'm a little jarred by the fluorescent lighting, but I skirt around aversions like that by asking for a seat by the window. And I peruse the menu, certain not to get too excited. It's about the pace and the expediency. I'm here to eat my eggs, pay, and to quickly walk to the door.

I reemerge on Mission Street wondering when Red Cafe will be dismantled and replaced by a fancifully-designed South Indian restaurant.
author: Peter H.

description:
I walked around about five neighborhoods in six days getting brunch and this was my favorite. They have a great mix of classic American dishes with traditional Mexican ones.

Everything was really fresh, amazing flavors without being heavy or greasy, and my benchmark veggie omelette with bacon was amazing, as were the oatmeal pancakes with strawberries. The only reason it doesn't get five stars was that the service was slightly slow and the coffee was standard diner fare and not great but that's unusual in a place like this if it is. Amazing location, selection, prices, and I'm still craving it days later.
author: Lauren C.

description:
This is a small spot in my old neighborhood.  Parking wasn't hard to find.  But wait wasn't that  long.

Chilaquiles needed more flavor compared to Pastores' chilaquiles.  I guess I just like it spicy.

fried platanos with crema... yum and portion was big for the reasonable price compared to other places
oatmeal pancake topped with strawberries... yummm, moist and oooh so ggood!  

I gotta come back here!
author: Claire J.

description: It is always good to come to red cafe. The food is always good and delicious... besides they have great service all the people that work in this place  are super nice.. This is one of my favorite small spots to get breakfast...
author: Yohana w.

description:
Yay! Found a great brunch place in the Mish! 
Interior is cute and people were profesisonal. No ghetto feeling leaving this place, so that is good as well.
Great chilaquiles, and platanos! Also had the veggie ommelette and it was good as well.

Smaller scale- If it gets crowded, you may have to wait to get seated and there is seating at the bar. 

Good times. Loved this place. Food is good!
author: C A.

description:
Tired of waiting in long lines for brunch and/or that hint of pretentiousness that it comes with?

If yes, then you can escape to the Red Cafe.  

Short wait time for American dishes with a Mexican / El Salvadorian flavor and flair, serviced with a friendly attitude.
author: Yeeman N.

description:
This is a great low key place for brunch in the Mission and perfect if you want to escape the mobs of hipsters.

I've been a couple times and we always seem to end up sitting at the counter since the tables get filled up quickly. They have basic diner breakfast food and some Mexican breakfast dishes as well. I recommend the corned beef hash. I've had it twice and it was great both times. A ton of food, especially if you also eat the toast. Service is great and prices are very reasonable for the huge portions you get. 

I spied some other tasty dishes the last time I was there, so I'll have to try something different next time.
author: Kenny J.

description: Best inexpensive diner I've found in the Mission. The food is cooked fresh (you see it happening), and they have a lot of options. I had the French Slam, which is French toast with two eggs, sausage, and bacon. Delicious. That plus coffee set me back $10.50 plus tip. Can't beat that price, or that food combination. Service was attentive and nice. The big problem with this place is that you will literally break a sweat just sitting down to eat because it gets so hot in there. There is no AC, just a fan that blows all the hot air from the kitchen throughout the dining area. The two times I've gone, I found myself eating very fast because I was so hot that I wanted to leave.
author: P U.

description: it's a good breakfast place with a lot of good looking mexican dishes. i could see coming here more. the coffee is a little thin, but that's the kinda coffee you expect. i got the chilaquiles which was just warm. I wanted them hot, but probably more so that day because it was raining. which is a good thing and all, but on that day, give me the chilaquiles hot! they have plantains which the gf loves.
author: Matt J.

description:
Service is quick, which is great for lunch time. Great selection of things to eat yet I wishes they had more salad choices on days u don't wanna eat like a cow.
Friendly service but some dishes can b pricey for what they are.
author: francis c.

description: I haven't an explanation for why they call it Red Cafe. Communist sympathies? Some long forgotten decorative scheme? Anyhow, it's not important. What is important is that my special lady can't get enough of their Eggs a la Mexicana. And not just because it's a dish articulated in three languages at once. Likewise, I put my faith in a chorizo and broccoli omelette and it has never failed to repay my loyalty. It must be said that Red Cafe carves through its formidable Mission breakfast/brunch competition like the mighty sickle wielded by the world's workers. Red Cafe forever!
author: Jeffrey P.

description:
Good service. Good food. Clean restaurant.

We ordered the supreme omelet and chicken/bacon sandwich with a glass of orange juice. All of it was great and our server was very nice and welcoming.

I was able to get some change for the parking meters here too.
author: H I.

description:
Great food and service!!

Got the French toast and it was really delicious. Prices were very reasonable. Would definitely come again for breakfast.
author: Rachael B.

description: Wow this place was just stifling inside; the ventilation of the place was just awful.  You'll smell smoky and all sorts of things when you get out of there.  The food was just ok to me. I had their desilada and it was bland and the flank steak was a little on the dry side.  The staff were really nice though.  Would I go back? Maybe....then just stick to pancakes or sandwiches.
author: Janis P.

description:
My friends and I came on a Sunday, we walked for a while and it was a hot weekend, and we were in desperate need of WATER by the time we got there. The place was a bit packed but we waited only about 7minutes and were seated, not bad, its a SMALL place but man it smelled amazing in there! 

Our waiter took our drink orders and I made sure to order WATER in addition to my drink. WELL, the waiter had a bad case of the hang-overs, or so it seemed. He brought our drinks but no WATER and left. Minutes later he came back, took our orders and i asked once again to please bring WATER. He leaves and comes back with ONE glass of water, there were THREE of us, do the math. 

We get our food, and had to ask for TWO more glasses of water which he then left and came back with.

FOOD was good, i decided to be a 'tad' healthy and go for the nopal omelette instead of the greasy yummy avocado and bacon one (sigh). It was ok/good. Plantains were good but had to ask for sourcream, I just expected the plantains to come with, but guess not.

Overall, good food. I'm sure the less 'healthy' options are much better, as is everything else in the world -__-
I didnt like the fact that it was very difficult to get WATER. But whatever. I would go back, and make sure i bring my WATER bottle, and try a less 'healthy' option
author: Brenda P.

description: This place is amazing!! I love the fresh squeezed OJ and chilaquiles. So freaking delicious.
author: Nicole S.

description: Sadly,  I am downgrading my prior review.  The Red Cafe had been one of our favorite breakfast spots in the City.  However, we noticed the shrinking portion sizes- not that big of a deal, as you still get ample portions.  But, the deal breaker came on Sunday, after ordering my favorite - the "corned beef" hash.  Sadly and to my major disappointment,  the dish was prepared with canned corned beef, which has the texture and appearance of cheap, canned dog food.   I would guess by the taste that it is also similar to canned dog food.  I couldn't believe it!  Please stop using this cheap disgusting processed product in your food!  I would much rather pay a little more and get the real stuff - cut up fresh corned beef grilled with potatoes and vegies.  The staff is still attentive and great, but not worth being served substandard food in a city full of choices!
author: Sandra M.

description:
MMMMMMM plaintains!!! 

If you like plaintains, go here! They are so deliciously made. It's worth making a trip here just for that.

As for what else I ordered, I simply can't recall. However, it was filling and good.
author: Margaret R.

description: Love this place. Great chillaquillas. Not much on the atmosphere, just diner style, but great food
author: Daniel Z.

description:
So imagine a Mexican diner, and this is what you pretty much get. It's a small spot in the Mission that serves a mix of Mexican and diner food, but don't let the menu confuse you. It's good. There are several booths and fewer tables, but theres a counter which adds to the entire experience. Some of the booths are small that they only fit 2 people, which makes it kinda nice, cause it sucks when I'm taking up a huge booth and I don't really need it. Also, if your lucky, someone comes in to play live music! Ahhh.. the life.

To be honest, I've only had breakfast here and would recommend it. Lunch is a different story.
author: Jessica H.

description: Great hangover breakfast. My roommate comes here all the time for the mochas, they're huge, pretty and smell great. You can also get a steak on the side! I got a breakfast quesadilla and they're really nice about substitutions and personalizing. Excellent pico with a little spice kick
author: Christine H.

description: This place is amazing! I always order the gallo pinto, platanos, and queso fresco plate! Delicioso! It looks like it won't fill your stomach, but it does! Totally recommend this place.
author: Joana F.

description:
Oh it's good.

Trust me on this one.

Whether you get the oatmeal pancakes, one of the many omelets or their bomb french toast, you will leave full, happy and under $10.

Sit at the bar or grab a table IF you can nab one.  This places gets packed with locals & city workers.

***  And make sure you ask for your water in a glass with lemon not a plastic cup if you're retarded about such things as I am. :)

The end.
author: Athena S.

description:
Thanks Yelpers for another great recommendation!

First, I can't remember the last time I had such friendly and attentive service. My friends were late, yet I sat at a table for four and sipped two cups of coffee as the place filled up. (I arrived at 10:30 a.m. on a Sunday). 

My friend and her 2-year-old son arrived and the wait staff was awesome. They repeatedly picked up and replaced the spoon the boy dropped despite us saying it was unnecessary.

Next, the food. Wonderful. The chilaquiles, the huevos rancheros, the oatmeal pancakes. I didn't care for the side order of plantains because I thought they were too greasy. But I felt that was more about me, than the restaurant and can't ding them as a result.

The prices were great. The ambiance was wonderful - packed with a diverse crowd - Mexican and not. 

HIGHLY recommended.
author: Kim C.

description: The food is good.  My favorite is Platanos con Casamiento y crema  queso
author: Eric P.

description: FYI its significantly hotter in the small restaurant than the outside temperature. I had hopeful expectations of this breakfast place only because it looked good through yelp. I had the corn beefed hash which was very filling. The corned beef was mixed with some fresh tomatoes mushrooms green onions, eggs and of course the hash browns. Unfortunately the other meal of French toast and eggs, had a small hair in it midway through the meal.
author: Valerie D.

description: Breakfast burrito review here!  If you want a nice tasty breakfast burrito that's straight up and nothing too fancy, Red Cafe is for you.  No exotically "Californian" ingredients and a nice counter to sit at make for a great hangover fixer.  The breakfast burrito here is pretty nicely sized and you can get it a number of ways.  I had bacon as my meat and it was solid.  It does get crowded here a lot on weekends though so be warned!
author: Gene X.

description: The service is great and very nice.  Very personable.  The food though is only ok.  It doesn't have any complex flavors and it overly greasy.  Some people might like grease, but if you want to live without a heart attack... I would not suggest this place.  There's nothing healthy here, so as long as you don't care about your health- you're good!  I had a fine time here but I couldn't finish my plate thinking about all of the grease that would be clogging my arteries.  I was with a friend that said her food was delicious but her taste in foods are not complex either....
author: Laura R.

description:
Red colored building on the corner makes this easy to spot decent breakfast/brunch spot.

Red Café is normally a hit with their Breakfast Burrito, Chilaquiles, Carne Deshilada or Fried Platanos. I tend to stay with their Latin menu and I'm a sucker for a breakfast burrito. I tend to mash their platter together and dump hot sauce on top with tortillas on the side, and recommend you do the same!!! Hot chocolate with a smiley face can help brighten the day.

My friends, however were not impressed with their omelettes with a slice of processed cheese on top. However, he did enjoy the shrimp in his omelette, but maybe he was just that hungry.

Waiting times are a hit or miss as well and some find themselves waiting outside for awhile, so don't plan huge groups without arriving early. Don't expect too quiet of a place with their radio and sometimes someone playing outside for change. 

Service is not really attentive and you must flag your waitperson to get refills. However, your food tends to arrive quickly.
author: Casey L.

description:
A greasy spoon diner with breakfast all day? Not so hard to find you say. 

A greasy spoon diner with MEXICAN breakfast all day?! Now that is a worthwhile find. 

I've had the carne deshilada and the chilaquiles here, both are awesome. Carne deshilada is shredded beef scrambled with eggs, served with rice, beans and tortillas. The chilaquiles are the best I've had I think for one reason - they are crispy. They bring the green sauce and beans to the table to pour over the top, instead of doing it in the kitchen and making a soggy mess. I add chorizo to the chilaquiles so that it is tortilla chips coated with eggs, chorizo, onions and green pepper then doused with green sauce and beans - mmmmm.

Oh, and if you want pancakes, burgers, waffles etc, they have that too. Haven't tried them though.
author: Sam P.

description: Terrible...didn't even get my food...the service is terrible and uninterested....while placing my order I was told to hold on while the waitress answers a phone call from a friend...I told her it was rude and she didn't seem to care...so I left...just lost two customers
author: Nicky T.

description: Wanted to have a brunch spot nearby, and this place is delicious. Definitely going to become a regular. Service was great and the portions were a good size. A large portion of their breakfast menu come with hashbrowns by default, which is a huge plus with me.
author: Kyle K.

description: The wait is 30+ mins even though you're told 10-15 mins. Had to tell the waitress we were ready to order even though they were in front of us joking around. t this point I have no expectations of good food. The food was ok.
author: CY R.

description: Thanks Yelp for helping me find this gem! PLATANOS!
author: Ralph S.

description:
I love this place! one of my go-to breakfast spots. cheap, always delivers.
i've ordered a lot from the menu, and i have always been very pleased with everything EXCEPT the huevos rancheros. the refried beans they use are very soupy, as is the salsa, so it's pretty hard to eat in any way other than with a spoon. but everything else is great! and the service is always very friendly/.
author: Emma A.

description: i Highly Highly recomment Red Cafe The food is awsome!!!!!!!  Great prices and good service ;) chilaquiles, platanos with casamiento, hot cakes with straberry and banana, Super chicken sandwich really good food!!!!!
author: Jessica T.

description:
The Latin breakfast food is without words one of the best. I always have the platanos and gallo pinto which comes with eggs, sour cream, piece of queso fresco, and toast. It fills my fat ass up fosho!! But their services sucks when one is Latino. Several people have complained about the same reason as to why they don't step
foot up in here again. The waitress staff is on top of whatever tables have non-Latinos to properly give them good service. I have learned to order everything I need at the beginning and not have to wait until the end of my meal to have my damn coffee refilled. I certainly ain't got time for that shit but when I do I step into Red Café!
author: Edwin R.

description:
Red cafe is is everything a person wants in a little diner on the mission. Good prices and the variety of dishes--made my decision very difficult when it came time to order.

2 friends joined me when I ventured here and I have to say all 3 of us were quite pleased with the food!

I can recommend the corn beef hash plate, the egg sandwich w/bacon and the plantains w/casamiento. Oh my, my....

Just know that the space is rather small, which can fill up quickly at lunch time. Oh, and be prepared for your clothes to smell like bacon for some time after. Mmmmm...bacon.
author: Hilda Z.

description:
When I moved to the mission I feared I would miss out on hangover breakfast...  wrong!  This place is packed on the weekend, but you can usually grab a spot on the bar.  The menu has a lot to offer; I haven't been upset with anything breakfast related yet.  The staff is really nice, and the service has always been great.

There is a serious lack of hipsters, however.
author: Jonathan B.

description: I had high hopes for this place when looking at reviews which were all shot down. My hash browns were half the size compared to the picture, I was charged for a refill of orange juice ( I wouldn't order another if I knew it wasn't free as it is in most restaurants) and to top it off my eggs a la Mexicana had no salt, pepper or seasoning (none) Top 5 worst breakfasts
author: Ben W.

description: Get ready for greasy. The fruit plate is one of the best around, simple and big. The beans are runny and the food is whatever word is opposite of vibrant. If you are hungover, have no food sensitivities, and want to sleep all afternoon this is your spot! Fun spot to eat with a tourist.
author: Jenelle I.

description:
Delicious and inexpensive brunch.

I had plantains, eggs, toast, cream, beans, and cheese for under $10- awesome!
author: Randy L.

description:
My girlfriend introduced me to Red Cafe.  It's a very unassuming diner and I wouldn't have thought to give it a shot but I'm very glad we did.  The whole staff is incredibly friendly and efficient.  And the food is tasty.  I think the best dish is the platanos con casamiento (I prefer my eggs over hard but over easy works too).

Oh, although it's probably not a big deal, I think Yelp has mischaracterized the restaurant----after talking with the staff, I'm pretty sure that it is El Salvadorian, not Mexican.
author: S E.

description:
DUDE! This place is WAY worth your time. Mexican breakfast here is exceptionally stellar. The Huevos Rancheros and the Chilaquiles are my personal favorites, and they're SLAPPIN'! 

Just have some, I'm sure you'll enjoy it.
author: Christina M.

description: I ate here due to the high Yelp rating and eagerness to try something new for breakfast/brunch. Was not impressed. Its a very busy cafe and I can tell all of the employees really bust their butts, BUT the food was low quality and near flavorless, great portions, but I left my take-out to rot in the car because it truly wasn't worth eating later. I felt rushed during my whole experience, which I am not one to dwell in any restaurant, but the staff and manager seemed to care more about getting the next person in, making another buck, than ensuring my partner and I had a good experience. I made a mistake, like we all do, but will never go out oc my way to eat here again. Thumbs down.
author: Banksy R.

description:
I came here with my buddy David C, who owns the State Farm Insurance agency across the street from this establishment.  I have never been to a Mexican breakfast joint before but this place was awesome.  I think I'm falling in love with the Mission district.  Such a great vibe in here.  Feels like an old school American cafe with a Mexican spice.  I guess this would be a fusion between south and west.

I had the corn beef and hash with two poached eggs.  The difference?  They spice it up with sauteed mushrooms, bell peppers and onions.

My friend had this mixed beans and rice concotion with eggs and a side of plantain.  I had to try some because it looked very good.  And yes..........it was very good.

During the middle of our meal, a street performer came in and started strumming his guitar and singing.  I swear..........only in the mission.  For a sec..........I thought I was in Mexico.

I really can't compare this place to any other like or similar places but personally, I thought it was fantastic.
author: jason g.

description:
Just moved to the area and was looking for a good breakfast place. This was the closest to me and what a great find! I went on an early weekday morning so can't comment for the weekend hangover crowd. Not crowded but not empty either (I'm weary of places that are always empty!). Service was friendly, attentive and prompt.
Food- Had the corned beef hash. Not what I expected but in a good way. I'm used to a typical greasy diner corned beef with hashed potatoes plate but the Red Cafe version mixed in all sorts of veggies and cheese giving it a great mexican accent. Imagine salsa ingredients in your corned beef hash and you'll get an idea of what they're serving up.
Restaurant was clean, and did not have a ghetto feel (I think other reviewers have commented as such).
I'll be coming back for my breakfast fix!
author: Eric P.

description: Breakfast burrito and a double mocha.  Came here for the weekly parking dance, and a new tradition has begun
author: Christian S.

description:
First off I have to say that the oatmeal pancakes are nothing spectacular. Yes, they were very oatmealy, but they taste like nothing more than, yes, oatmeal, and a little flour, cooked in lots of butter. Tasty, but again, not spectacular, and I'm betting nowhere near as healthy as you would think or hope.
And speaking of buttery, my scrambled eggs we pretty much broiled (though cooked nicely) in it. The flavor overpowered the usual strong flavor of eggs. And it was served in a small pool of butter. Clarified, I think, since it never congealed on my plate.
The accompanying sausages were good, but deep fried. Suffice it to say the breakfast nearly stopped my heart despite my leaving half of it.
To top it off, they charged me an extra two bucks to sub oatmeal pancakes for buttermilk pancakes when on the menu the oatmeal ones are cheaper. Doesn't make much sense, does it? But I can't be too pissed because the server warned me that it might cost more. Still doesn't make sense.
Also, service was patchy. I waited a smidge too long to get my check and then receipt.
So why two star instead of one? Their onion rings. Delicious, perfectly fried, cornmeal crusted pieces of heaven they were. They definitely know how to fry their stuff, I have to give them that.
author: Karen C.

description:
Meh, not really very impressed. Me and the wifey met a friend here for breakfast. kind of nice to have that diner feel, but that was somewhat obscured by the musicos that came in half way through the meal. Still pretty cool though. 

I wish that they had more latino foods on the menu. I got the Carne Deshilada (Machaca), which was alright. I was craving it and it hit the spot, but far from the best I've had. The rice was pretty flavorless and the beans were watery and bland. Wifey got the "Supreme Omelette", which was really more of a scramble and used cheap yellow sandwich cheese. She was not impressed. I think each dish was about $9. We also got a side of platanos con crema, which was very good, but difficult to screw up. 

My biggest complaint? after reading about the pupusas, they don't even serve them anymore. Why? No idea, but this was by far the biggest disappointment. Thankfully, La Santaneca is across the street, so I will just stick with them when I am craving some cheesy goodness.
author: Miguel V.

description: I love this place! The wait is never long even when there is a line out of the door. They have a great selection of both Mexican and American breakfast items. And their pancakes and scrambled eggs are perfectly cooked.
author: Priscilla M.

description:
One word: CHILAQUILES

Chilaquiles are, in my opinion, the king of all breakfast foods! Red Cafe does a nearly sauce less version which made me apprehensive at first glance but the result was crispy and tasty.

 I would definitely go back and order them again!
author: Miriam W.

description: The food is okay. The service is terrible. The waitress with the blonde hair was so rude and had no matters what so ever. While I was eating she literally reached over to change the sugar bottle which wasn't necessary and totally disgusted me after seeing her sweaty arm go over my food. Definitely never went back after that.
author: Marylou V.

description: I usually come here with my family or my bf and get the same thing, the French slam (2 bacons, 2 sausages, 2 eggs, and French toast) its so good. If you wanna try something different, I would suggest the Plato mixto. Overall great service, great food and a great time.
author: Jill P.

description: My partner and I ate here for the first time weeks ago and loved it.  It's now a new place on our list of Sunday brunch places.  It's definitely got a line at peak times, but it was worth waiting 15-20 mins for.  It's a cross between taqueria food and typical American brunch fare, which is perfect for my tastes!  Friendly service and festive crowd.
author: Scott L.

description:
Finding a spot that has both regular breakfast and Mexican breakfast is an oddity; finding a place that does both WELL is a downright rarity. 

Chilaquiles: delicious. Oatmeal pancakes with strawberries: delicious. Fried plantains with crema and beans: even more delicious. 

Word of warning - that green salsa is not your basic, mild-ish salsa verde - it is HOT!
author: Devora Z.

description:
BIG NUMBER ONE: This place is BEST for breakfast, don't go there for lunch, it's quite mediocre for the price, got a fajita, and although the sauce was good, the beef was low quality, (it grossed me out) and the grilled chicken sandwich was bland. But as far as breakfast goes, it's all good!

BIG NUMBER TWO: The music is horrendous!! And they crank it too! This is restaurant, not a bad club people!!!!! And yes you better consider that fact! :)


FOOD 4 Breakfast: 4* (in terms of price)
FOOD 4 Lunch: 2* (only because the onion rings are greasy-licious)
SERVICE: hit or miss
MUSIC:  - 5* !!
author: M S.

description:
Im glad were back - claiming this to be "OUR" place is an understatement as there are a lot of  "OUR" places such as this.

Service is excellent, food is great and very affordable.

Go check them out.
author: Malou C.

description: So I'm from Australia and this would be the best BREAKFAST I have had in awhile! Great tasting food, friendly staff and speedy service! HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!
author: Ava R.

description: I like coming here when I'm in the neighborhood because the prices are pretty reasonable, the food is good (and not greasy), and you can enjoy eating in peace. They have a decent selection of breakfast options, which are the only items I really order. The coffee is WEAK, though. They really need to stop watering it down.
author: Suzi G.

description:
This place is traditional American breakfast with a Latin twist.  I came to eat on New Year's Day and it was packed! The customers were chatting about the events of the previous night and the employees were buzzing around this very small diner like bees. And throughout our meal, there was always a line to get in.

Once we got seated, at the counter : ), our waitress took our drink order of a double latte and coffee. I love coffee! So, I know good coffee. The coffee was good and strong and the latte was excellent. It almost had a caramel taste to it.

When she dropped off our coffees our waitress then took our order: French toast, Latin scrambled, and country scrambled. 15 minutes later she returned with a magnificent site of food. The eggs were soft, fluffy and NOT dried out (like some places).  On the country, there were tons of chopped ham, green onion, and 1/2 an avocado. YUM!  The French toast was thick, but not Texas toast size. Sometimes Texas toast is too thick.  Anyway back to the French toast, it was cinnamonnie, a little eggy, crispy around the edges, and soft in the middle. 

The only cons:
1) The wait to be seated. However, I'm not counting that, because it
     was New Year's Day and nobody wants to cook on NYD.
2) The toast was cold and I had to put on the butter. Spreading butter
     on cold toast not so good.

Prices:
I forgot to write down the prices and I cannot find a menu online, however, nothing we had was over $9.00.

Overall:
It is a great place to have breakfast at a decent price! I will be back, but this time I will have something on the Latin side like casamentos (rice mixed with beans), eggs, and platinos (large fried Latin bananas). I can hardly wait!
author: Anna d.

description:
This is the standard go to for me and Manfriend as it is in the way to the BART station from where we live. I LOVE the chilequiles, and the salsa verde that comes with it is perfect for it. Manfriend loves the corn beef hash. 

The food isn't top notch, but it's fast, tasty, and cheap.
author: Kristin N.

description: Went there with a couple of friends for brunch on a Saturday around 1. We got a table straight away and the service was fast. The food is very, very good, and the portions are huge. I had the breakfast quesadilla which was amazing. We left satisfied and will be back for sure
author: John W.

description: The oatmeal pancakes were nothing special, they were like any other pancakes. The other dishes were not that great . I wouldn't really come here again.
author: Charles Z.

description: Not a bad place for breakfast on Mission. Service was not the greatest though. It's like you have to go past being assertive to aggressive to get helped. Food was good enough that I would come back after noon if I were in the area.
author: Alex M.

description:
While I was eating here, I thought the yelp review would be lower than it is.  Maybe they were just having an off day, but my experience sucked and I don't think I'll be returning.

I went for breakfast, which was fairly priced.  I ordered a coffee and had to remind the waitress 15 minutes later.  When when I downed it, I had to ask her for a refill, even though I was sitting at the bar right in front of her.

The food was about what I'd expect from the price, but the hash browns were very lackluster.  Tasted like bland shredded potatoes.  Maybe I would have had better luck ordering a Mexican breakfast?
author: Paul G.

description: Great food! Love the All American Breakfast but today I tried the  Casamiento with huevos rancheros and it was off the hook! Definitely will return!
author: Jorge M.

description:
Breakfast service was impeccable and unparalleled for all my wanderings about in The Mission. My coffee cup runneth over ...

The breakfast quesadillas are awesome, and the staff is very not only very attentive but also helpful if you have any questions about the menu.

I don't know what this place was before this present incarnation, but the interior design is good, if not a little off in places. Like, the tables are too big for the booths along one wall, but hey -- the food's good so quit yer bitchin'.
author: Wes T.

description: First of all i walked in and the lady that was there was too busy having a conversation on the phone to attend me. After 10 minutes she finally got to me I told her i had ordered by phone and when i tried paying she said her debit machine didn't work. I understand sometimes that happens but the fact that i called ahead of time and she didn't mention it is what makes me mad. The food is decent nothing great.
author: Nancy D.

description:
My breakfast combo had the option of toast or tortillas my tortillas came out with a plate of butter and jam on them...uhh what? So obviously I asked for salsa only to find out  they charged me $2.50 for a spoon size serving of pico-de-gallo. Nowhere on the menu does it mention salsa is extra. 
 The food took FOREVER to come out and they basically let the mariachis panhandle in here nonstop while you're trying to just chill the fuck out and eat an omelette. Get your  terrible guitar playing out of here dude! So many better places to grab some b-fast here don't bother.
author: Dis B.

description: LOVE this place and so does everyone we take here.  Chilaquiles are the best I've ever had.  Plantain plate is great.  Husband frequently orders an egg scramble, can't remember the name, delish something. Huevos Rancheros, authentic - not the Americanized version.  He once ordered the carne asada Burrito and they asked how he wanted his meat cooked.  He said it was the best burrito he's ever had.  I'd stick with the Hispanic dishes.  Only miss?  Coffee is wicked weak.  Cheap, delish eats.  Go!  Great service.
author: Ottis M.

description: Very much enjoyed the chilaquiles and will return to try more.  Would have liked it a bit spicier, but still one of the best I've had.
author: Michael K.

description: Very solid dinner. Always busy. A breakfast plate (omelet, hash browns, sausage, etc) is ~$7, sweet deal.
author: Thabet A.

description:
We live at Valencia and 25th, and find ourselves going to Red Cafe  almost weekly for mid-morning breakfasts. Simple, diner-style food with veggie scrambles, delicious refried beans and decent coffee. Don't come here if you expect a mimosa-soaked gourmet brunch. Fresh pupusas are served M-F 3-9pm with puerco or pollo. Muy delicioso. 

ps this place is almost always completely empty.
author: Emily G.

description: It's a diner!  Who'd have thought by the name?  Really great veggie omelette and not bad prices either.  The radio blaring advertisements wasn't all that enjoyable though, but a mariachi soon showed up and thankfully they turned the radio off.
author: Daniel H.

description: I ordered a Denver omelet but the food was dry and unsavory. The staff was great though.
author: Andre J.

description:
The food was very mediocre.  I have never had such bad service.  Ordered a dish with eggs sunny side up and got scrambled.  No big deal.  But when I asked to get my eggs changed to what I ordered (which shouldn't have been a big deal either), the waitress came back and told me in a very angry tone that I had ordered the scrambled else.  After saying this to me, she just stood and stared at me as if I was the one who should have apologized.  Finally got the order right but the bad attitude remained throughout the rest of the restaurant experience. 
I have worked as a server for many years, and this treatment to any guest is unacceptable.
author: Nicole W.

description:
I've been to this place twice, and both times was lucky enough to grab a seat almost immediately.  

I've ordered the same thing, both times (the veggie omelette with swiss).  The veggies are so fresh and the eggs are moist.  Very flavorful, and a splash of hot sauce puts it over the top.  The hash browns are crisp on the outside and tender on the inside.  Also comes with a side of toast.  

I tried a bite of my mom's order of oatmeal pancakes...and they were okay.  I expected something different.  They tasted, now bare with me, like oatmeal in the shape of a disk.  I expected fluffiness and more flavor.  Is that how oatmeal pancakes are supposed to be?  I wouldn't order them.

Like everyone else raves, the chilaquiles are amazing!  If you can't decide what to order, just get these and indulge!

Fast, and friendly service.  Very busy during breakfast hours, so expect to wait.
author: Lesliegh H.

description: The breakfast I had (eggs a la Mexicana) was tasty and filling. I recommend this place and will definitely come back again. The price however was a little more than I expected. When I sought out to find a cheap breakfast nearby, I had a range in mind of $5(-ish). Besides the $4.25 French toast, everything was in a range of $6 to $10. It's worth it; it's just not what I had in mind as cheap. I went in on a weekday late afternoon. Service was fast and the crowd was very minimal.
author: An Marie M.

description: I just devoured a breakfast burrito from here and it was mighty delicious. The bill was ~$10-$11 for the burrito plus hash browns which is a little steep for a breakfast burrito. The burrito comes with scrambled eggs, cheese, and your choice between bacon, sausage, or ham. You also get a side of beans, pico de gallo, and salsa verde. The service was friendly and they take card which is always a plus for me. I'll be back soon.
author: Grace C.

description: I was contemplating making my own breakfast burrito this morning and after the burrito I received this morning, I should have went with that route. To start off, the breakfast burrito cost $7.99 plus tax. I don't mind paying any cost as long as the quality is there. The choice for meat are sausage, bacon or ham. I requested if I could have all three meats but with equal amounts so as if I only had one. They told me I would have to be charged an extra $2.99 and I said ok. So this breakfast burrito is now $11 plus tax. I get home to open my to go container and I have a burrito not even half the size of an el Farolito regular burrito that cost $7. I tell myself it must be the quality and that's why it's so small. I take a bite out of this kid's meal and it's mostly egg with barely had any kind of meat in it. Remember they charged me an extra $2.99 because i wanted the mixture of all three that they offered. If I didn't live so far from this place, I would have came back to ask them how the burrito they gave me cost $13 but I decided to write a yelp review instead. Talking about highway robbery. Lesson learned and will make sure none of my friends or clients ever give this place any business. Good job red cafe. Kudos for your shady business practices!
author: Kristoff F.

description:
Cheap, but not all that great for brunch. Had the plantains, coffee, pancakes, and a cheese/spinach omlette. Agree with others about the music: they really crank up the overplayed pop songs (Miley Cirus, Katie Perry, Far East Movement, etc). Not that I don't like pop music, but it's not the type of music I envision having a relaxing Sunday brunch to.

The pancakes were not memorable. The plantains were pretty good, but I should have ordered something savory on the side (like hashed browns) to take the sweet edge off. 

My boyfriend got the omlette with spinach and cheese. He asked for feta, but they had few options and he went with American. The omlette was a bit on the wet and drippy side, and hilariously enough, no cheese was inside the omlette. Instead, a slice of Kraft was perched on top of the soggy spinach omlette.
author: Sylvia L.

description:
In search of a greasy spoon for my huevos rancheros fix one morning, I walked to Red Cafe and posted up at the counter.  This is exactly the experience I was after: a decent, cheapish meal, some borderline undrinkably bitter coffee & acquiescent (but not notably friendly) service.  

Forget brunch, sometimes you just need some food fuel in an unpretentious setting to start your day.
author: Christopher R.

description:
I love this place....and I mean LOVE.

I became obsessed with gallo pinto and plantains for breakfast when I was living in costa rica, and never expected to get the real deal when back in the states.  Then I moved to the MIssion!

My sister and I always get the platanos con casamiento because its the best.  Her boyfriend has eaten everything on the menu and insists its all the best.  The service is wonderful, your coffee is refilled before you can even think to ask, and its usually quick to get a spot.

Enjoy!
author: J Z.

description:
I am obsessed with their chilaquiles.  You must mix the sour cream, beans, and salsa verde on top to get the full effect.  

Their french toast was also excellent.  I was upset initially that they didn't put butter on or provide butter on the side for them.  One bite and it was apparent needed no additions outside of the standard syrup. Damn good french toast.  Probably would've still tasted great without the syrup.

Service was kind and timely.

Now get off your yelping ass and go here!
author: Pickles T.

description: Perfect last meal to end our trip to San Francisco. Ordered the veggie omelet with corn tortilla. The egg and fillings were perfectly cooked. The hashbrowns were yummy too. The waitress was friendly and the food prompt.
author: Amy H.

description:
My new go-to neighborhood diner. Quick and good food. My fave is the croissant sandwich with ham and HONEY... magical.

Note: If you're a sanitary freak, don't sit at the counter. You'll see things that may freak you out! ;)
author: Simon S.

description:
Pretty yummy brunch spot! The place was packed on a Saturday noon, but got seated within 10 minutes. The food is delicious and quick, the OJ freshly squeezed.  (corned beef hash with poached eggs. YUM)

As we were eating, a Lady of Guadalupe parade went by. Only in the Mission!
author: Carol L.

description:
I thought this place only served Mexican food but I have discovered they have good classic eggs and sausage breakfast too.  This is a good place to go on Sunday Morning when everywhere else is packed.

I also recommend their chicken salad.  The chicken has a very good flavor and is not too dry + the dressing is tasty.  I tried their shrimp fajitas once and that was yummy too.
author: Elisabeth B.

description:
Food: I tried their eggs + plantains + bean-rice thingy + queso fresco + tortillas for brunch today. It was dreamy...who knew a Latin brunch in could be this amazing! I can't wait to go back and try other things. Coffee was good too!
Service: cute waiter with a charming smile and great service, why didn't I leave him my phone#? Oh that's right, because I plan to go again really soon!
Atmosphere: they have a weird faux finish on their walls and no pictures anywhere! It looks totally bare in there, like they're still working on the design. I think some pictures and accents can really make the place look charming!
author: Venatius P.

description:
Wonderful coffee! Delicious food! Great breakfasts at reasonable prices!

Our Tuesday Koffee Klatch tries to include Red Cafe at least once every 8 weeks or so. We sit at a window table, sometimes occupying 2 of them. We have lots of coffee, and good lattes and decent teas, as well as sampling various things on the breakfast menu. 

Red's south of the border breakfast menu items are right on, the food's hot, plentiful, authentically flavorful.

It's a bit noisy at peak times, and pretty crowded, but that's the way of it in a place the locals treasure.
author: Calla F.

description:
Yum! I am in trouble because I can see this place from my new apartment and will prevent hours of banal arguments with my hubby.

Just getting settled in to a new place and still not sure where the silverware and plates are packed finds my husband and I out in the morning for breakfast pretty often.

Me - let's get breakfast burritos!
Him - I want a bagel
Me - we had that yesterday
Him - I still want a bagel
Me - fine, we can get bagels but only if we get tortas for dinner

As we're walking to the bagel place I peeked into Red Cafe and saw pancakes for him and salsa for me! We immediately went in.

I went with the eggs Mexicana and asked for salsa!  Excellent - I had the ranchero salsa and it had a rich chili flavor. Hubby had the oatmeal pancakes and loved them. For me, they tasted too much like oatmeal but this really is a good thing!!!

Very generous portions, I didn't finish my eggs or beans and didn't even touch the hashbrowns. Next time I'll ask for no potatoes and see if I can get a piece of fruit. You never know.

We will be back.
author: Allegra F.

description: Well, "huevos rancheros" were really good. Red cafe this you'll lost one star because the all time me and my brother were at the restaurant. Waiter didn't ask  how was everything or if we need more coffee. I'll be back because the food, especially the breakfasts are really good.
author: Lu G.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to eat breakfast. I really love the plantains and the beans and rice combo (casamiento) . I am never disappointed.
I suggest going early before 10am to get seated quickly. 

For lunch I recommend any of the sandwiches. 
Happy eating!
author: karla l.

description:
I was really in the mood for some quality breakfast food. Coming from Michigan, good diners are plentiful, however I have found it hard to find a good diner-esqe place in the city. Most good diners are either pricey, or gross. 

I had a great experience here, good food, good atmosphere and good service.
author: Brittany B.

description:
2.5 stars.

A good option in the Mission if you and others you're with can't agree on whether you all want Mexican breakfast or American as the menu has both.  Prices are definitely reasonable.

Food:
Oatmeal pancakes:  good tasting if a bit thin and gummy.  I liked that they aren't cloying as many pancakes can be and I got them with fruit which made it yummier. 
Huevos Rancheros:  +1 for the slightly spicy salsa roja and delicious refried beans - but the beans are pounded, almost sauce-like, so there's no texture to enjoy.  Tortillas served on the side rather than beneath the eggs.
Breakfast quesadilla:  cheesy and yummy with the accompanying pico, guac and sour cream. 
French toast:  pretty good, lacking the bite of a little cinnamon and could be crispy on the edges.
Fresh squeezed orange juice:  room temperature but otherwise pleasing.

Comfort/ambiance:
Here's where the place fails.  Many, MANY tiny black flies dot the walls and occasionally swoop in to buzz your dishes.  
As at least one other reviewer mentioned, the booths are very small so if you're bringing three or four adults you'll be jockeying for elbow room while you eat.
Expect to find some sticky substance on the table or on the condiment jars - as you would in any greasy spoon diner.

Service:
Ask for water once, then twice.  Is it conservation or unawareness?  You be the judge.
You'll have to wave over a server if you need something, do not expect the customary "How are you enjoying your meal?" question.

I'm pretty sure the cheap, decent eats will be enough to entice me to visit again but I'll likely elect to sit at the counter if it's more than just me and another.
author: Ben S.

description: The Red Cafe has great breakfast but their cheeseburger and fries aren't very good. Bland meat, flat patty and the fries are mushy. I'll only go for breakfast. Chilaquiles are good. ;)
author: Cesar B.

description:
I had a great breakfast here there other day. It was good, classic, breakfast food: bacon, eggs, toast. Super cheap and convenient, and EXTREMELY fast service.

The atmosphere is fun too. Reminded me of a diner in some random place you'd stop at on a long road trip.

A great place to go when you roll out of bed on a Sunday morning craving a hearty breakfast.
author: Francisco L.

description: This is the place to be if you're looking for a delicious breakfast any day of the week! I'm a native from SF, but live in the eastbay now. So whenever I'm back in the city in the morning, I'm always craving an omelette from Red Cafe! The service is fantastic. Waiters are very attentive to your needs! This place gets super packed on the weekends. I love to come here for breakfast during the middle of the week!
author: Karla M.

description:
Red Cafe is a great little diner spot for brunch.

Low on frill, lots of butter used in the food prep, and I'm a big fan! You can get breakfast classics or Mexican indulgences, plus unlimited coffee for about $10 a person.

Don't wait at Boogaloos, stroll a little bit farther down into the "real" Mission and check out Red Cafe. Your stomach will thank me!
author: Shannon B.

description: You know a place is good when I give it 5 stars after I got my car towed outside of the restaurant!  The chilaquilas are some of the best I have ever had.  The breakfast burrito is also delicious.  Everything is made right in front of you and it is very quick even with the crowd.  If you are craving Mexican go HERE.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Chill.  Friendly.  Homey.

Great place to sit at the bar on the shiny red stools, make small talk with the cute guys behind the counter, and chow down on some comforting chillequiles.

I actually prefer the soup-ier chillequiles that my line cook friends would make late night, but this crunchy, hearty, filling amalgam of scrambled eggs, peppers, and freshly fried tortillas satiated my Mexican desires for the night.

Major plus for friendly service and the cook actually serving our split plate chillequiles on separate plates - totally expected to play fork wars with my girl date.

$7 for large plate of chillequiles plus soul comforting refried beans and sour cream on side.
author: Jane L.

description:
Generally a good, basic diner with some tasty, not-so-standard-diner options. Previous experiences included great, friendly service along with delicious chilaquiles and breakfast quesadilla. This morning, something went awry. Red Cafe has been busy and bustling every time I've been there, and today was no different. Friendly, helpful waiter took our orders but when the food came something was terribly wrong. 
Chilaquiles, check. Plantains, check. I brought my mother today and she ordered the hash, which comes with poached eggs and toast. First on the table: cold, soggy toast that had the crusts detached and thrown on top of the pile of sadness. That got sent back, and new toast came with a smile from the waiter. OK. Then the hash came, and one poached egg was a hard fossil while the other egg had the yolk broken and oozing its innards before the plate even got introduced to the table top. I didn't notice this because I was busy digging into the chilaquiles. The waiter was called over and informed of this. My mom clearly told him she would go ahead and eat it, but that it seemed like this was a mistake on the part of the kitchen to let something so sloppy come out to service. He seemed confused as to what the problem was at first, presumably because a little broken yolk is common to serve up to the customers there. I don't know. But then he starts excusing the issue by blaming rushed service. There's no need for that. Just apologize, offer to replace and move on when that offer is turned down. Customers just want to feel like their complaint is heard.
My mom asked that the manager be informed too, since all she was getting was sloppy plate after sloppy plate. The manager was the worst part of the whole experience. He came over ready to fight, it seemed. He opened with accusations, and seemed angry when he asked my mom what she wanted, saying they already offered to replace it or take it off the bill if she didn't want to eat it and that he didn't "want to argue" about this. She said she didn't want to argue either, she just wanted to say that this isn't what should be allowed to be served and she wanted to bring it to their attention. He said if she kept talking and "arguing" he would have to call the police. Frankly, I'm sorry he didn't because they would have laughed in all our faces. Voices got raised and he finally went away but presumably not because he realized he was being a jerk since he never said one word of apology.
The check came, and our waiter apologized again. Since he had maintained a friendly demeanor the whole time, I don't hold anything against him. The hash was indeed off the bill, which was very nice of him since it was not something we asked for. Bottom line, kitchen needs to look at what they're sending out and management needs to take a chill pill.
author: Whippy C.

description: A little live music, some plantains, hash browns and an avocado and bacon omelet!  These are some of the greatest joys in life. The food here is so tasty and good. Like mentioned this little cafe has one waitress and lots is business. The service is fast and despite the line, they don't rush you (tho we hurried). The food was delicious! Plantains were sweet but not too sweet, and were perfect with the beans and sour cream. The hash was soft and the crispy on the outside. Avocado in the eggs with bacon- great combo! Go and cheek out this worthwhile place!
author: reviewer m.

description: Always reliable for some warm tortillas and tasty breakfast, definitely one of my go to places to have breakfast in the Mission.
author: Ken W.

description: This is a cute little traditional bfast place with a Latin flair. My omelet with shrimp and hashbrowns subbed for iceberg lettuce was really good. Sitting at the bar was cool. Lots of coffee and water refills. The plantains, arroz con moro and crema looks really appealing for next visit.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I've been living in SF for years and go to the Mission frequently but it wasn't til this year that I discovered Red Cafe. What a great place!  

A friend was craving breakfast in the late afternoon so we found this place on YELP. The food is excelente! We had casamiento- a popular breakfast dish in Central America (also called gallo pinto in Costa Rica). Eggs, rice & beans, fried plantain,a dollop of sour cream & a bit of farmer's cheese...served with  either corn or flour tortillas. I think it's their signature dish on the Latin American menu. I order it every time and every time someone I take asks the server for a recommendation, this is it. So... signature dish.

They have other latin american/mexican/nicaraguan/salvadorean standards. I love pupusas and they have those too. Loroco and cheese. Good & different menu item- order it.

For 'american' food, the oatmeal pancakes are great, too. I've shared a short stack of those each time I've gone. glutton. A great alternative to buttermilk, buckwheat or cornmeal.

The service is great. The servers and host are always friendly and they do their best to turn the tables around and get you seated. It seems they're developing a solid reputation as a good breakfast place. However, unlike other places I've seen that have the hipsters & marina crowds lining up for overpriced and underwhelming ice cream or bacon n eggs,  this place is the real deal because of the menu, value, and the people. I hope they can maintain that and the bigger crowds.
author: Lu R.

description:
Great mexican-style breakfast. I had the vegetable omelet on the recommendation of my server, and I was quite impressed (although I did kind of want to eat cactus). It came with excellent hash browns and average wheat toast.

They kept refilling the coffee faster than I could drink it. kind of messed up the coffee/cream/sugar ration, but I can deal. Great for all the caffeine addicts out there...

The prices were reasonable - about $8 for a large omelet. I would go back any time.
author: Dana L.

description:
No frills straight-up breakfast.  Very simple, pretty fast, just fine if you're starving.  Or broke.  Or both.  Very friendly service, totally reasonable wait and the place was bustling with families.  

I mean, a girl can't go to MBC every single Saturday & Sunday...
author: Emily T.

description: Great service and the food delicious, chilaquiles and ham & cheese omelette 2 of my fav's, keep the good work !!!!
author: Hermes L.

description:
Awesome breakfasts there! They have a great staff and the food is consistent--that's important! I hate going to restaurants and the food tasting different from the last time I went. I know what i get here and that's a huge + 

I recommend the casamiento for breakfast.
author: David C.

description:
When you get an omelet in any breakfast joint you are at the mercy of the cook. I won't call him a chef. Anyone making breakfast is a cook - even if his name is Emeril. Lunch and dinner, a chef. Back to the omelet. For me the omelet must not be shingle tough on the outside, not browned on the outside, and not runny or gooey inside. Sometimes the ingredients lend themselves to mucky interiors but if the egg is solidified, them I am good. 

We had a western omelet, and all criteria above were satisfied. The onions, green peppers and ham bits were diced to small enough pieces so they were cooked and not overbearing. I like hash browns extra crispy, ordered them that way, and they were. My wing man got some pancakes and inhaled them, but what the heck, he'll eat anything. They sure smelled good. 

All the stars available. Breakfast Ho!
author: Peter H.

description:
I have lived across the street from Red Cafe for about a year now, and I am kicking myself for waiting until last month to explore it. Now I must admit, while it has always looked warm and friendly inside, I had trouble gauging the "sktechy-ness factor" of the establishment. But I went in there hungover a while back and their food its like a defibrillator!

I was instantly brought back to life by Red Cafe's huevos rancheros, while my friend had pancakes and hash browns that were also top notch. Plus, when we walked in we were greeted by some excellent live spanish guitar. 

All in all a great little place. My roommates have come back for breakfast and lunchtime burgers and have also enjoyed them. Friendly, attentive staff, reasonable prices, and hearty portions of both American and Mexican breakfast fare.
author: Lauren C.

description: Great food! Reminded me of my mother's cooking every sunday before church when I was little. Only problem I would have is that there isnt any ketchup at any of the booths, and the waiter who attended me would run off before I could ask for any! :(
author: Jose A.

description:
Not that I can eat  like this often without having heart problems later but the Salvadorean breakfast is worth the gut bomb.

Eggs, tortillas, casamientos (bean and rice mixture) and plantains with a taste of Salvadorean cheese and sour cream. OMG. 

So good. And so full. You need to take a nap after breakfast, no joke. 

Service was pretty friendly and prompt.
author: Mona M.

description: CHECK YOUR BILL BEFORE YOU PAY!!!!!!!!! .................so I have been to this spot several times and had a decent breakfast I usually get a machaca breakfast....I will have to say everytime I visit there our several items on the bill of which didnt have or they charged for condiments like table chili for your food...also if you ask for some extra tortillas they overprice the tortillas...anyhow I'am not a cheap skate however I have never been charged for a little tiny bit of chile for a mexican breakfast ever.....This is the 3rd time they over priced and charged out for table chile....And when I say table chile like the kind you get a taco truck....AGAIN PLZ BEWARE OF ALL BILL BEFOR YOU PAY....After I asked the waiter who I believe is the owner...I told him what the items where on bill because was shocked they charged me $2.50 per table chile......He stated that they charge everyone the same for table chile.....unheard of .....anyway we also had to pay $2.50 for a few tortillas they also charged us a bill for splitting a dish........Im very fair however go somewhere elso to eat a decent breakfast in the mission....if you do try plz beware of the suprises on your bill...............good luck
author: Susana S.

description: Had the $9.99 Camarones lunch special with sauce, beans and rice, and it was pretty good.  It came with 6pcs of shrimp and I understand that shrimp is expensive to begin with, but overall, I expected a little bit more from this dish, for the $10 I had paid for.  I noticed that prices tended to be slightly expensive here for most menu items, compared to what you could similarly get elsewhere.  The service was good and when we came here, the place was packed and we sat at the only table available, near the door, next to a bunch of hella loud people.  By the time we were about to leave, the place was over half empty.  I would come back here again, but I would definitely order something else the next time!
author: Kahanalei M.

description: Red Cafe is a breakfast staple of my roommates and several close friends who also reside in the Mission.  It is a great hangover cure and a wonderful start to any Saturday or Sunday.  The wait is rarely long, the wait staff is friendly, and the food and coffee refills are prompt, the latter frequent.  The menu is big and has your basic breakfast and lunch options alongside some Mexican additions; everything I've had has been tasty and filling.  Favorites of my friends and I include the corned beef hash, the French Slam, and the BLT.  Mission denizens need look no further for a quality, basic breakfast joint.
author: Alan R.

description: oatmeal pancakes yum! Food is fresh and lots of fruits! Good service patient staff !
author: Sophie L.

description: I decided on this cafe based on reviews. I am attempting to find qualities I can rate highly and really cannot. I do not understand why it received four stars and this is what I am most disappointed with. Perhaps friends and family wrote all the responses?It is an okay place.  with no ambiance at all....really old tables and chairs, the walls are dirty and need to be painted, The food was overpriced and mediocre. We had five people and we were forced to tip at 15%. While I would do this normally, I did not appreciate not even being told they intended to force us to tip. I would never go here again. Nothing about this place or its style or food or service deserve four stars.
author: Jill A.

description:
Their nopal (cactus) omelette is tasty, and something you don't see on a typical diner menu.  Serving mostly breakfast items, they also have sandwiches/burgers and Mexican dishes, such as quesadillas.  I'm fond of the veggie burger here; it's cheap, and they don't skimp on toppings.  It drips with so much grease and oil that it's almost as unhealthy as a regular meat burger.

With several tables and booths, the dining area is that of a no-frills diner.  Red Cafe dishes up good comfort/hangover food for when you don't want to hit one of the many taquerias that perpetuate the area or wait at any of the more popular breakfast spots.
author: Marsha Z.

description:
Classic diner with consistently good Latin and American brunch food.
Slightly high prices, but their friendly staff makes it worth it.
My favorite thing on the menu is the Platanos con Casamiento (fried plantains with beans and rice).

Weekend brunch tends to get busy, but the wait isn't usually long.
Hooray for frequent mariachi passthroughs.
Ambience is down-home and lovely with lots of light and inviting dusted orange walls.
author: Raina M.

description: Definitely not a bad spot for some breakfast!  The pancakes are delicious and fluffy. My aunt is enjoying her steak and eggs which she ordered medium-well (but in actuality she wanted it medium) and it came out exactly how she wanted it -medium. Haha.
